Reviews.Content: I just got my tv yesterday, so I will probably update this down the line, but so far, I love it!Setup was quick and painless, though I have not calibrated the screen, which you should do. The standard picture is a bit too vivid for my taste, but everyone has different tastes. For the $700 I bought it for, the 4 hdmi inputs are a value! I use everyone and the need to not use an hdmi splitter was a big deal to me! I don't know how tv manufacturers today can sell a any tv above 40" with two hdmi ports! It's absurd!My complaints after one day are:1. The remote sensor seems a bit sensitive, in that you need to aim it precisely at the sensor.2. Where is the spotify app? Coming later with update?3. Screen is more reflective than my last tv, but that seems to be the norm for tv's today.I think all my complaints are minor and this tv is an excellent value, with a great picture! I would definitely recommend this tv.

Reviews.Title: Consider your viewing angle
Reviews.Author: someone
Reviews.Content: 1 Con:Brightness and shadow detail are reduced drastically with viewing angles below the TV.  We're using this in our bedroom up on a dresser. When lying down in bed, it's acceptable but it's borderline. I don't recommend this TV if it's intended to be up much higher unless it can be angled down. Our main larger JVC LCD TV and Viewsonic LCD monitor are pretty solid and don't degrade this bad. Not sure if this is an indicator of Vizio using cheap panels. For our viewing angle I'd give this a 3 rating but the pros bump it up to a 4.Pros:-Nice picture when viewed head on, plenty of adjustment options-Matte screen, no glare-It's 1080p. While it may be overkill for a screen this size, it certainly doesn't hurt. The larger 28" version is only 720p and there are reviews complaining about its resolution.-Surprised how well the WiFi works connecting to a G router downstairs at the opposite end of the house.-Netflix works well and is the latest version-Nice menu system-Decent remote, slim frameNitpicks:-Sound is tinny but this was expected.-There's a guide button on the remote but it doesn't show much of the over-the-air EPG. It just shows the current show info but with a font size way too small to be readable across the room. Too bad most manufacturers don't at least have the ability to show and scroll through a simple Now and Next info for all the stations.-The way the Vizio logo hangs down on the right side is a bit goofy.-Amazon's app currently doesn't work but that fact is clearly stated on the site.

Reviews.Title: Good 55" HDTV at a good price
Reviews.Author: MovieMan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV as a replacement for my Samsung HLR5656W, an 8 year old DLP HDTV that recently died. I'm not particularly interested in the wireless features or apps because I use my PC connected to the TV for everything; I'm sure wireless would be frustrating for an HD experience until wireless ac equipped TV's become standard anyway. I don't use DVD players, or watch television. I only have my PC and PS3 and can only speak for this usage.Picture quality out of the box is pretty good, but the settings may need to be adjusted. Default settings have extreme brightness but washed out color, and a bit of playing with settings resolved this. Afterwards, I was impressed with the TV's overall clarity, although disappointed with the pixelation in darker scenes and SD content. However, in the advanced settings, I toggled black detail to low, and afterwards experienced no problems with pixelation, clarity or color. With the PS3, when using game mode, the display seemed more responsive and has less lag. In both cases, they are connected via HDMI in 1080p. I don't have anything else connected, and don't make use of the tuner at all, but from my viewing experience with the PC, I can say HD content looks stunning, and after playing with some of the settings, SD content remains watchable (I feared otherwise in transitioning from DLP to LED). The bezel is nearly invisible, giving the TV a slightly smaller feel than my old TV, but the viewing experience is improved overall. I use a Logitech Harmony remote, which I had programmed and ready to go upon receiving the TV, so have only used the included remote a bit, but experienced no problems with it. The viewing angle is acceptable too; I can still watch about 40 degrees off center with only a slight dimming effect. My only true complaints are the lack of power button, and that the TV seems a bit wobbly on the included stand; I assembled it correctly by sliding into the base of the TV and bolting from the back. It should be okay if my cat decides to nuzzle it, but this is earthquake country, so stability is always a concern. It should be noted that this review was written the following morning after receiving the TV, so I cannot speak to longevity yet, but will update my review based on any problems I encounter.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: RJ Wallace
Reviews.Content: We received this TV just a few days ago. So far so good! My husband is a very 'techy' guy and researched and researched televisions before making this purchase. Although he had some reservations about the Vizio brand itself (older models aren't quite this quality) we have been extremely impressed with this television. Looks very sleek, light weight, great picture and you can easily access Netflix, YouTube, Amazon, etc. with the click of a button. Definitely recommend. Don't pass up the price!

Reviews.Title: Awsome
Reviews.Author: RJ
Reviews.Content: Great price great product, so often you purchase products that are a little overwhelming if you are not a techie, this product was sop easy to set up, it took a few clicks of the remote to set up the TV and the wifi, excellent would highly recomend

Reviews.Title: Great Tv
Reviews.Author: Sylvester Gordon
Reviews.Content: Ordered from amazon and was shipped to me by CEVA on time. Overall it's a great Tv, no problems setting it up, hooked my xbox one up to it and played a few games & it looks amazing. Blu-ray is outstanding with this tv, really is worth $700 considering everything that comes with it, even though I would have liked if it came with a qwerty remote, the ability to toggle 120hz on or off & the fact that you have to point the remote directly at the sensor for it to work, it's nothing major though. Other then that, there's really no problem with this Tv; great picture, more then enough apps & super thin bezel. Trust me you'll be satisfied with this.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: Dan Kolterman
Reviews.Content: This is a great tv for the money. I looked at tv's hard, for quite awhile, and ended up purchasing this dispite no reviews. I couldnt be happier with my first flatscreen. It was very simple to hook up and the wifi was just 1 click on the remote :). Vizio internet apps plus works great and that was the main reason behind this purchase. Actually this is a 2014 model tv, and they are cheaper than the 40" 2013 models! Best of all the picture is amazing plus the very slim edge design (<10 mm) is very similar to the "razor" line-up. Audio is actually good I think, which is saying something since my girlfriend seems to think im deaf.

Reviews.Title: WiFi (and other functions) not very good
Reviews.Author: R. S. Wanat
Reviews.Content: Had problems with WiFi even though signal strength was a full five bars.When I was able to connect, I attempted to login into Amazon Prime the the tv "crashed" .

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: reyknowso
Reviews.Content: I decided to go back to Vizio after many yrs of Sony Tvs. And I'm glad this tv is excellent and it fits perfectly into a bedroom space

Reviews.Title: Great smart Tv
Reviews.Author: Ant
Reviews.Content: So i just recently purchased this tv the picture quality out of the box was a little poor but with a little mixing of settings the picture can and will look stunning. the sound of this tv is really loud which was a huge surprise for me i have done testing on the usb video formats it plays most popular video files like.MP4 and AVi but sadly NO .MKV unless you change its file name extension then it weirdly works. its speeds for a smart tv is pretty good faster than my Sony blu-ray player the only thing i dislike about it is some of its apps UI or interface. The tv itself is really light it mentions about 15.27 pounds on the box but feels a lot lighter than that. I gave it  four stars out of 5 mainly because the control; because it does not have a  qwerty keyboard and i thought it did since it was presented on there website on the E series page but i guess it is only for the 60" or above which is a bummer.  but other than that the tv is awesome and for the price its is a steal. got it for 429.99.. for the size and specs of this tv it is definitely a steal.

Reviews.Title: Basic small TV for kitchen area use
Reviews.Author: J Elias
Reviews.Content: The size of this tv is perfect for use in a kitchen area which was the primary reason for its purchase. The picture quality is decent and access to internet functions is okay, not great, but an added value. The sound leaves a lot to be desired so don't buy this tv if sound quality is important to you. Overall for the money a decent buy.

Reviews.Title: k indep mo
Reviews.Author: Kevin H.
Reviews.Content: excellent picture,sound (with the right cable provider) very sleek and lightweight. excellent shipping not even a scratch on the box

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Very Brown Bear
Reviews.Content: Could not have asked for a better TV, it does everything that I want it too.There is very little I could add to the other reviews. The only thing to keep in mind is when playing downloaded movies from a flash drive (which it does really well, mind you) not every single format will work, that goes especially for older video encoders so just keep that in mind, but this TV still plays more codecs and formats than most Samungs, Sonys and other brands out there, even compared to VIZIOs from last year.

Reviews.Title: Definitely Worth The Money
Reviews.Author: G. Saffer
Reviews.Content: My ten year old Olivia 42" LCD died an untimely death, but expected death. Since I knew it was coming, I'd been looking at potential replacements. It came down to this or a 46" Samsung. I was a bit leery of Vizio since I had an older 22" unit that stopped working and turned out to be unrepairable due to cost of the parts. It was only 3-4 years old at the time, so I was less than pleased.I read the reviews with that in mind and it seems like QC issues with earlier Vizio sets have been resolved, so I decided to buy the 48" unit.I set the unit up at home using hints in some of the reviews and it's a great TV. The picture is, as I would expect, 10 years better than what the Olevia gave me. I love that very little real estate is taken up by the bezel around the screen and I get much more picture in the same size footprint as with the old set.Unlike others I don't have a real problem with the supplied remote. I might try to find a replacement with a real key board, but other than that, it does what it's supposed to do even with the Amazon Instant Video application.Which brings me to the part I don't like so much. Intermittently the applications that require Internet connectivity won't work because the set reports that it's not connected to my router. I opted to run an Ethernet cable instead of relying on WiFi because of some of the comments about choppiness with streaming video. Every once in a while, the TV reports that I am not connected and I can't use the Amazon app to run videos. So far restarting the TV has corrected that, but I suspect that the problem is with the TV and not my router. Actually, I know it because the first time it happened, I plugged the cable in to my laptop and it connected to the Internet just fine. In fact one time I ran a video through my laptop into the TV using the HDMI out on the laptop and HDMI into the TV. The video ran just fine.My guess (and it's just that) is that it's a firmware or software problem with the set and it will be fixed with a future revision. Which brings me to a question. Does the set automatically check for updates or is there a manual process for that?So far I'm very happy with the TV other than the Ethernet issues. It turns on quickly, switches from HD to SD quickly, and has very good sound even with the standard speakers. I also like the power on light option and the fact that it doesn't play an annoying power on sound as do the Samsung and some other brands.

Reviews.Title: Bought from Amazn and cant get amazon
Reviews.Author: Randy
Reviews.Content: The amazon app has been in an up date since we bought the TV, when we called and asked about it we were told it would be a week for the up date to finish and here we are a month and a half later with no end in sight. great TV but we only use Amazon Prime and Netflix so its a pain in the rear not having this feature when we were counting on It being available

Reviews.Title: Most apps don't work
Reviews.Author: James Hughes
Reviews.Content: My picture appears highly pixelated when viewing the only app that will start, Netflix.  For 700 bucks I'm not sending it back, but yeesh what a disappointment.  Does anybody actually test these things?  My other Visio, on the same wifi network, usually has a nice picture and all the apps work.  Maybe it is because this is such a new model that the app vendors haven't gotten their updates done yet.  I will wait and see.  I wish I could get XBMC as an app, so I wouldn't have to use a media PC.Update:  I ran a lan cable to the TV as the commenter helpfully suggested, and I now have a good picture from Netflix and no connectivity issues.  I read where Vizio is replacing this TV if yours happened to get a defective wireless unit (as many seem to have).  Important note: the Amazon App that used to just show a black screen now reports that it is under development and to check amazon.com/videohelp for more info.  That just dumps you into generic help.  With Prime going up to $99, I hope they fix the app soon.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money on this tv
Reviews.Author: Barbara Stephens
Reviews.Content: I should have read the reviews more carefully. I just got this tv yesterday for use in our room over the garage rec room. I am planning on only using it for streaming shows for our young granddaughters. The set up is super simple but it couldn't find our wi-fi. I called for help and was told the wi-fi in this tv isn't very strong. I bought an extender to boost our wi fi signal upstairs That cost me another $60 at best buy. Our iPads and laptops do great up in that room so I assumed the tv would too but it didn't.( we have a strong signal router)  Next when I got online with the tv I easily went onto net fix. When I tried amazon prime the app is there but it isn't working. I came back online and re-read the reviews more carefully. The app is there but no able to receive on this tv. We LOVE amazon videos and now the girls won't be able to see their favorite shows. I am so disappointed. I'm keeping the tv only because it's too much trouble to send back. We have the signal now and can get netflix. But PLEASE we want amazon prime video too. It's our favorite.

Reviews.Title: All the hardware is there, just a few minor 'wants'.
Reviews.Author: Thomas Wilson
Reviews.Content: 1 week of ownership with the 2014 Vizio E550i-B2 55" Full Array LED Smart HDTV:I have been following this 2014 Vizio E Series release hoping to replace my 4 year old Vizio 47" E Series. Up until 2 weeks ago the only retailers where Amazon and Sam's Club. Just so happens I am a Costco Member plus I am not fond of shipping large fragile things so I was waiting to buy... Then my monthly Costco trip came up and what did they just get 3 of? The E550i-B2 55" Smart LED HDTV. (Since they have gotten about 20 more creating a whole pallet stack display.) So after pondering the decision over Charmin Ultra, and Baby Diapers. I had them load 1 up to take home.Killer price point (Amazon does not have the lowest price on it...) plus at the end of the year I get 10% back on it because I am an 'Executive Club Member'. So being a Technofile 1/2 the stuff I got at Costco stayed in the car because I was pulling my old TV off the wall ready to mount that 55" beauty up there! It only took about 5 minutes to get the VESA mount off the old TV and on the new 1. First thing I noticed was the VESA mounts are super low compared to my older Vizio ( but then again there is about 1/2 as much weight ). The upgrade from 47" to 55" is pretty substantial especially since this is my Bedroom TV ( I actually replaced a 7 year old Philips 42" LCD HDTV in the living room with the 47" older Vizio out of my bedroom. ). With 3 boys, a XBOX 360 & a XBOX ONE I am not too welcome in the living room, LoL, so I have our bedroom setup.It did not take anytime to get the TV up and exploding with "Full-Array 120Hz LED HD" that is extremely better that my 4 year old LCD, especially when watching full 1080p like Blu-Ray or the AppleTV. Even with my Motorola Dual Tuner HD DVR from the cable company, the 1080i it puts out is a lot crisper and vibrant that my older model Vizio. It is also great using my AppleTV and Airplay to display my MacBook Pro so I can sit back with the laptop on the nightstand and use my Bluetooth Keyboard & Mouse to get some Photo editing done ( or surf the net ). So far the picture quality is almost as nice as my Apple 27" Thunderbolt Displays.I would say there are 2 things that are not up to 'snuff', the Remote Control is plain useless ( it is like a downgrade from the previous E Series's QWERTY remote plus it is NOT even universal so I still need my DVR Remote, my Blu-Ray Remote, ect. So I programmed the TV code into the DVR Remote, which is universal and it will do everything the Vizio Remote will, even Apps and have been scouring the net to see if the alternative Vizio QWERTY Remote will work on the 2014 E Series B line but the TV's are so new no one has any information yet.), and next is the VIOS Apps PLUS content... Other than Netflix / Hulu, which my AppleTV, and Blu-Ray already have, there is really nothing of sustenance on it. Even after forcing myself to get a Yahoo account, thinking I could possibly download additional Apps, notta', There previous Google Apps setup was better that this. Lucky I have the AppleTV's, and Airplay (not to mention a massive iTunes Apple Lossless Music, Canon EOS 5D Mark III 21MP RAW Photography Aperture Library and 1080p .m4v Movie collection on my 2 WD 8TB Thunderbolt RAID's that will display beautifully using the AppleTV but none of those formats are used by this Smart App Center).So as far as the hardware, display, quality, size, and value for the $$ this next Generation Full Array LED Display are 5 stars. The Remote and Apps bring it down 1/2 a star for me.Would I purchase again? You bet! Do I hope for some software updates and optional Remotes, definitely. The E550i-B2 did just start shipping at the end of January so hopefully these minor issues can be addressed. ( I noticed they also just started shipping the 60" E Series B line and pricing is right on par at the next level, so I am satisfied with 55" at $679.99. ) But this is only a week old unit, with a lot of new technology in it. We will have to update at 6 months and a year to see if they hold up.

Reviews.Title: Netflix issue, Router Compatibility
Reviews.Author: FluxCapTime2010
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to this TV considering it's the only sub 32" Smart HDTV available, upon arrival I opened it hooked it up, went through the on screen setup and everything seemed to be fine except when it came time to run Netflix. The TV continued to give an error code and after spending a good amount of time on the phone with both Vizio, Netflix, and Comcast and it was determined that the Netflix app on this particular model was not compatible with my router (odd) yes I know. I googled/researched a fix and came up with nothing, I am somewhat tech savvy and couldn't figure this thing out for the life of me. On a side note, picture quality was fine, youtube app worked ok, and it is a good size for a bedroom or a monitor for a desktop.  Sucks I had to return it to amazon, guess I'll be getting a Samsung soon as I get my refund.

Reviews.Title: Worthless
Reviews.Author: Mistress Rebecca
Reviews.Content: I am honestly perplexed by the number of positive reviews on here.  I got this mainly to watch netflix without having to have another device.  The first unit connected fine--though with some buffering issues that I wasn't sure were the television's fault.  But the picture kept getting dark, then getting light, then dark again.  Very irritating.  So I exchanged it for a different unit.  This one wouldn't connect to netflix, even though it was connected to internet.  After downloading 25 updates, it also wouldn't connect to amazon.  Oh, and then the remote stopped working entirely--not even an hour out of the box.  I'm not betting on the third time being the charm.  I guess I'll go with a different brand.

Reviews.Title: Great TV all around and a great price
Reviews.Author: Rebecca C Weber
Reviews.Content: It was very easy to hang on the wall and start up was as simple as turning it on.Easy access to Nelfix and web pages.  You really can't find anything like it except Samsung for a few hundred more dollars.  I have both and can't see any difference.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding!!!
Reviews.Author: W. Lightfoot
Reviews.Content: For the money you pay, you can’t find better. The picture is bright and sharp and the sound for the size is great. Sound level will differ by channel as it does on my 55inch 3d TV. The white bleed in on the bottom is only when screen is blank, normal for led. Trust me when i say that i have been an electronics geek for 30 yrs. and you can’t go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Really great.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Is perfect for the price!  If you're on a budget and want a good looking TV then this is the choice!  The picture quality is great and my xbox runs great off of it and looks amazing.  You will want to look through the other reviewers to configure the picture quality once you get it and it will be perfect.  You dont need one of those fancy expensive TVs to get a good picture.  This fits the bill.  The remote sucks and you have to aim it just right in a certain direction for your key presses to register. but overall I am very satisfied with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Calling this a "Smart" TV is an insult to my intelligence.
Reviews.Author: R. Nixon
Reviews.Content: Even getting this TV to the point where I can access apps involves about a 45 second delay. Apps use one of two totally different UIs - one which covers the whole screen and is extremely slow and unresponsive, the other of which is a weird half-screen overlay that is also extremely slow and unresponsive. As far as actual app offerings, you have Netflix, Hulu and YouTube. There are others, but they are mostly no-name video sites with very little content. There used to be Amazon Instant Video app, but it got pulled. Supposedly, Vizio is "working" on fixing it, but well..progress has been slow and Vizio's support is unresponsive as to why this advertised feature with a dedicated button on the remote is no longer available. Since I got my TV, there have been approximately zero new apps added to the store. Developers of at least one app submitted to Vizio for approval have described their experience with getting their app on the store as a nightmare, with Vizio constantly dragging their feet.The TV itself is OK, the quality is acceptable for the price, but nothing to rave about.Do yourself a favor and either put your money towards a better smart TV platform, or buy the dumb version of this TV and buy a Roku or Apple TV to provide "smarts".

Reviews.Title: Great tv, especially for the price
Reviews.Author: Hpu2000
Reviews.Content: I own other VIzios and this is the best one yet.  The picture quality is better than other HDs I've had.  I love how lightweight it is and the very slim casing which leads to less bulk.  Lots of useful features, easy setup, great picture.  Occasionally, the sound is slightly muffled, but this may be my connection and not a tv issue.  The only thing I didn't like was the remote, which seemed cheap and not all that user friendly.  However, I use my DirectTV remote instead and the Vizio remote stays in the drawer.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture, but has a few glitches.
Reviews.Author: Entropia Universe
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv to put in my sons room after we canceled cable. Wanted a smart TV so I wouldn't have to buy another Roku but now it looks like I'll have to buy one anyway. This tv often loses connection to my wifi network. I have 2 Roku 3's that work flawlessly when I want to watch Hulu, Netflix, or Amazon prime but this so-called "smart" tv can't find my network half the time. Disappointed but at least it was cheap.Editing this review because now the "smart" tv has developed alzheimers. It forgets my wifi password. How is that even possible? Would return it, but it's just easier to buy another Roku. Hey Vizio, you guys should call Roku and ask them how they do it. Better yet, just put Roku in the TV.

Reviews.Title: great value
Reviews.Author: K. lawrence
Reviews.Content: this tv is a steal for $600 the picture rivals my Panasonic plasma for a lot less money of course you will need a soundbar or surround system to get decent audio I agree with other reviewers the calibrated picture mode is best standard mode is the energy efficient mode so far no quality control issues that others have mentioned and when switching to a different input eg hdmi 1 to hdmi 2 for 1st time you must set the picture mode again unless you are using standard mode then tv will remember update if you will be viewing tv in a large room with people spread out the picture really suffers from a wide angle update 5/30 amazon app is now working and there is a full review on cnet with advanced picture settings cnet gives this set 4 stars and said best tv for $

Reviews.Title: It's a nice enough tv
Reviews.Author: tonydelap
Reviews.Content: I am unhappy with it overall as it seems to hang up when you try to do something a little too fast.  It also took several weeks before I was able to use the Amazon app as it was "being updated;" it works now but I am an avid watcher of Amazon Instant Video and was rather unsettled for a while.It is a very nice tv in terms of color and other aspects.  My only gripes come from the "smart" aspect of it as it seems a little than than intelligent sometimes when it fails to respond to my button presses.

Reviews.Title: All the TV I wanted for a great price
Reviews.Author: Bmw Rider
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv for my bedroom.  This is my first led tv, so I can't really say how it compares to others.  The picture quality is excellent.  It has all of the connectivity that I need.  The smart tv hooked up easily to my router.  I have a usb flash drive with all of my  digital pictures stored on it, plugged into the usb port.  It's a lot of tv for the price and everything works the way I expected to.  I would definitely recommend this tv to anyone who wants a smart tv for a low price.

Reviews.Title: Nice little TV
Reviews.Author: cgbosn4 - Ret.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this HDTV to replace one that had died in the kitchen.  It has good sound and the HD picture is very nice and a BIG improvement from what I had before.  I've only used the "Smart" wifi feature to link up with my Netflix account and found that to be very easy and love the "Netflix" button that is right on the remote, wonderful!I have two issues with the TV though.  The stand doesn't allow the TV to be tilted at all so the screen remains vertical.  My other concern is that if you're looking at the screen from an angle (45 deg. or more from straight on) the picture kind of dulls out some.  Not sure if this is common with HDTVs but makes watching a little difficult depending on where it's set up.Other than those two things I really like this HDTV.  The price was wonderful, delivery quick, set-up easy.  Would purchase again.

Reviews.Title: Amazon App now working!
Reviews.Author: MikeE "MikeE"
Reviews.Content: I got this TV a month ago. I waited to review until the Amazon app worked, as that was the only negative, as far as I was concerned. Buying a TV from Amazon, which has an Amazon button on the remote, which didn't work, seemed kind of weak. All is well now. Picture (using settings I found here in a review) is excellent, and the sound is acceptable for our bedroom, too. I can't find a negative thing to say. Except maybe that the price dropped since I bought, but Amazon just credited me the difference, so I can't even complain about that. I'd say, if your teetering on the fence like I was, just grab this one,

Reviews.Title: Great product for the money!
Reviews.Author: Angela McMahon
Reviews.Content: I was surprised how great this tv considering the other reviews.  The picture quality is great and when I shut the tv off there is not a buzzing noise....it is quiet.

Reviews.Title: TV is good .. but AMAZON PRIME does not work
Reviews.Author: Wayne Stevens "Texasweb"
Reviews.Content: TV is sharp, but was missing 4 of the bolts that should of been shipped with the TV for mounting.  Biggest disappointment is that Amazon prime does not work on this TV.  Called Amazon and they said that they did not know when it would be fixed because it is a 2014 model and that I was suppose to keep trying and eventually it would be fixed by Amazon ..

Reviews.Title: An outstanding TV
Reviews.Author: Charles R. Horn
Reviews.Content: Limited to a 50-inch television cabinet, we had to order a replacement set to fit. This one is perfect in size and with a 5-inch lifting stand is at just the right viewing height. Setup was easy except for getting channels to load - we had to call on Vizio Tech Assistance for that, but while she was looking up the process in the manual, we figured it out.Tech Support was very helpful and we had a very short wait - unlike most tech support anywhere these days. The controls are very intuitive and easy to adjust. We read some complaints about the remote control, but it works well for my wife and me & we're both over 65 and did not need to call in the Grandkids for setup.  We still have not perfected the picture, but its very close & we'll keep adjusting until we find the right settings. The weight of this set was surprising - actually lighter than a smaller Samsung flatscreen that it replaced. The price was very fair and so far we don't regret any part of the purchase from quality of product to the 2-day fulfillment of the order to the tech support.

Reviews.Title: Very good, great investment
Reviews.Author: Leandro
Reviews.Content: The TV has a modern look and a good image.The sound and remote control are also good.The installation was easy and quick.The wifi connection was simple.I am using the HDMI connection, but the picture looks better using the VGA cable.The app for youtube works fine, but the app for Amazon did not work.Not exists a web browser for surfing the internet, there is also no option to install new apps.I'm using as a monitor for my laptop, it was a good investment.But how smart tv there are better options on the market.

Reviews.Title: Great value.
Reviews.Author: D. Johnson
Reviews.Content: Great value for the price.  Quick and easy set up.  Super easy to sync with my wifi.  Uber easy to log into my Netflix account and Amazon streaming account.  I obsessively tinkered with the settings trying to get the best picture for a few days until I finally did a google search and used settings listed on an independent blog.  Only tiny complaint (which I didn't deduct stars over) is that the TV is wobbly on the platform, as others have noted.  HOWEVER, the TV is only wobbly when I was actually moving the TV.  But there's zero movement when I'm just walking near the TV or just sitting and watching it, so I'm not going to worry about it.  As someone else stated, it only wobbles if you wobble it.

Reviews.Title: Clarification for most of you.
Reviews.Author: Nicholas E. Williams "Zilliak"
Reviews.Content: From what i understand:This TV is a true 60hz panel with backlight scanning....its not real 120hz and you notice this pretty easily.This tv has amazing depth and picture quality with a little degradation in color.For the price you really cannot beat this product.  The apps are a little weird but eventually work.  The bezel is thin and the tv is lightweight.

Reviews.Title: Not so smart TV
Reviews.Author: Rock
Reviews.Content: The TV worked great but after just two weeks the smart feature would not work. Vizio's tech support personal were very nice, we tried everything they could think of to fix it...and they did but the problem came back the next time I turned it on. After four calls with them and I don't know how many hours on the phone I gave up. I'm returning it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: L. HODGES
Reviews.Content: I'm very satisfied with my purchase.- Excellent picture- Excellent sound quality- Easy setupThe only downside I've noticed is the Smart TV apps. Having already owned a Roku player, I'm a bit spoiled but I don't think the Smart TV apps are ready for prime time. The Netflix app works well enough but other apps don't work as seamlessly as the Roku player apps and the Amazon video app on this TV hasn't worked at all for me since I've bought the TV. This isn't a major problem. It doesn't take away from the overall value of the TV and I would definitely recommend this model to others...

Reviews.Title: Great TV - Amazon App Doesn't Work
Reviews.Author: Robert L. Vessel "New Age Buddihst"
Reviews.Content: No problems with the TV except although it has an "Amazon Button" & App, it doesn't work.  I contacted Amazon and they advised that although "they are working on it" as yet there is no App for this TV.

Reviews.Title: I love my Vizio
Reviews.Author: Sharon L. Rogers
Reviews.Content: Beautiful color!  Had it installed yesterday and I just wanted to sit up all night and watch it.  My first HDTV!

Reviews.Title: Very happy
Reviews.Author: Desi
Reviews.Content: Like most, I agree the picture out of the box leaves a bit to be desired, but after tweaking, is really quite good.  The motion blur is so slight compared to the cost savings of a comparable unit it is hardly worth mentioning.  Blacks are black and colors are bright and vibrant.The Wi-fi set up was easy (other than entering the key with the low end remote, but hey, it's a one-time thing) and my signal strength is excellent.  (My router being in a room across the hall from the TV.)  I have had no trouble with streaming from an old 'G' router.And speaking of streaming, the dedicated Amazon app button on the remote does not work, BUT if I use the Vizio Internet Apps button and navigate to Amazon, Prime streaming works just fine, thank you.  The product page still says Prime doesn't work and will need a firmware update.  If it ain't broke...  Anyway, not that I feel I need one, but I can't find a way to manually check for a firmware update.  Perhaps it is checking every time I turn the set on?Finally, I read on some review there is no power button on the unit - that you need the remote to turn it on/off.  Not true.So far, so great!  And thanks Amazon for delivering the day after I ordered it.

Reviews.Title: vizio b2 series
Reviews.Author: Dr. Jake
Reviews.Content: The tv is easy to setup.  The wireless connection was quick and easy contrary to some other peoples reviews.  Apps have a bit of lag or slow response when clicking through stuff as noted in other reviews but to me its not  a huge issue.  Amazon is unavailable due to an upgrade ATM.Biggest dislikes are the TV stand.. It seems pretty cheap and if I were to bump the TV even slightly It may fall over.  Also the remote control / tv reponse, most of the time I need to press buttons more than once to do the command I am trying to do.Overall I am happy with this TV though.

Reviews.Title: Great Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Jessica N Wray
Reviews.Content: Great Smart TV. Easy to connect and use for all the streaming apps I use like Youtube and Netflix. Exactly what I needed.

Reviews.Title: Good picture
Reviews.Author: JackWill
Reviews.Content: So far we are pleased with this tv.  The two drawbacks so far is that there is no querty keyboard available for it and the apps system is not to my liking.  You are not able to download new apps, plus there is no browser available.  The Amazon app doesn't show your saved or favorite list.  Having no querty keyboard makes it hard to find the shows you want to watch.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Geoff "G. Swanson"
Reviews.Content: I chose this Vizio because I wanted a TV with a good picture but I don't care for 3D. There were some good early reviews on this model with its full array design as opposed to edge lit and high number of dimming zones (16). I was replacing a 9 year old Olevia 37" set, so I was expecting a giant leap forward and so far I have not been disappointed. I am not a videophile, whatever that is, but I am interested in getting a good, up to date product, since I don't plan on replacing it for a long time. I was planning to buy a Samsung or LG but decided to try Vizio because it had only the features I cared about at an attractive price.Design:The bezel is so thin it pretty much disappears. The TV is very lightweight (35 lbs), which makes wall mounting pretty easy. The VESA mounting holes are very low (only about a foot from the bottom edge) so careful measuring is a must when mounting. I bought a new Cheeta Mount which seemed flimsy but holds the TV well enough. I was able to handle the unpacking and setup myself, and my wife assisted with hanging it on the mount. There is more screen reflection than my old set  but the image is bright and it's not a deal breaker. The full user manual can be viewed on the TV or on Vizio's web site, the included Quick Start booklet is just for the basic setup.Picture:I think the picture quality is really good. There is quite a range of brightness so the picture is viewable in a bright or dark room, and the blacks are very black with good detail. I'm using the Calibrated (dark) preset and auto brightness set to High, and this seems to work well day or night. The other presets are too bright for me.Connections:4 HDMI  connections is nice, my old set only had 1. The ports are accessible (with a little patience) while the TV is mounted on the wall but it's probably smarter to make all the connections before you mount if possible. Swithing between inputs is very fast and each can be labelled so it shows which component it connects to on the screen instead of just "HDMI 1, HDMI 2," etc. I decided to plug everything in directly to the TV instead of using my Sony receiver to switch inputs because it works so much faster. I'm using the optical out to send the audio back to the receiver and this setup works very well with no lip sync problems. Before plugging in the optical I spent a few minutes trying to get the HDMI audio return to work, but even though both the TV and receiver manuals said it should work I gave up. Optical doesn't seem to have any drawbacks anyway. Some sort of connection from the TV back to the receiver is necessary to get the audio from the built in apps (Netflix etc.) to the receiver even if I did choose to use the receiver as a switch, something I hadn't thought about ahead of time. I have nothing to say about the built in speakers. I checked to make sure they worked but I never expect to use them.Remote:Very good for a TV remote, the "V" button kind of reminds me of something from the Disney movie "Cars." Nice design touch. I use a Harmony remote most of the time but so far I haven't figured out the programming to control the built in apps (Netlix etc.) so I use the Vizio remote for that.Smart TV:I didn't care about the apps or WiFi but they came along for free with this very reasonably priced TV. The WiFi connection was easy and works fine, though the TV is right next to my router so I would expect a good signal. You can also plug in an Ethernet cable if you prefer. I've tried the Netflix and Amazon Instant Video apps, both work fine but use an older design, not as nice as the Apple TV or Roku versions. Apps get updated all the time so I expect these will improve. I did retire my 2nd gen Apple TV which I used mostly for Netflix because it only supported 720p and the Vizio version provides 1080p which is an obvious improvement on this larger screen.Delivery:Amazon "Enhanced Delivery" was provided by Pilot. Once Amazon sent it off to Pilot I lost track of where it actually was, but a little over a week after purchase the driver called me and asked if I was at home to receive delivery. I was expecting them to make an appointment in advance but it worked out OK. The box was undamaged and easy for the two of us to get into the house. The driver (not an installer, just a driver) said that his instructions were to unpack, remove the materials, and plug the TV in to see a "blue screen" indicating that it worked. The day it arrived the temp was 5 degrees F and he said that the TV had been in the cold warehouse and that it should be left in the packaging for several hours to warm up before trying to plug it in. He also advised me to keep the packaging. This seemed to make sense, but after about an hour it was warm to the touch and I was able to unpack and connect it myself without much trouble. I think the driver may have just wanted to get going a little faster, but as long as there was no damage it was OK with me. It was much easier than trying to get it home from the store myself.So, I'm very happy with this purchase so far (1 week). I haven't seen any of the problems reported by others, and I'm hoping it will last a long time.

Reviews.Title: tv
Reviews.Author: Elaine
Reviews.Content: I am just getting use to it, as a smart tv. love it. It dose not take up as much as my old tv of the same screen size.

Reviews.Title: Great smart tv
Reviews.Author: Anna Andreis
Reviews.Content: Excellent tv, good quality even with an hd antenna. Easy to configure, the smart tv options work very well. Suggested.

Reviews.Title: lightweight, fast, fully featured
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Vizio is delivering a solid product at a very reasonable price. this is our second one. Our first one was slower to start up and slower performing on the Smart Apps. This one is very quick and nicely featured. It's also freaky light--less than 30 pounds means one person setup .

Reviews.Title: pretty cool
Reviews.Author: David Treat
Reviews.Content: i dont know what it is about vizio but their stands always are complicated. the picture is great but the online features are sometimes a little slow. all in all a nice tv.

Reviews.Title: Picture settings will not save.
Reviews.Author: Shannon
Reviews.Content: After getting my Vizio E420i-B0 TV (March 28th). I've had to spend 2 days on the phone with technical support. Due to the picture settings will not save. So every time the TV is shut off. Then turned back on. The picture setting have to set again. After two days and several hours on the phone with Tech support. To have me unplug this and unplug that. Reset to factory settings. As requested by the Tech support agent to send in photos showing the issue. This morning I get a phone call from what I assume was a Tech support agent. Explaining to me that Vizio engineers/support is aware of the issues and working on getting a firmware update to fix the issue. Of course no one knows when that will be. A month? A year? My concern is. Why didn't the prior Tech support agents inform me that it was a issues they were aware of at first. Instead of me having to call back and spend several hours on the phone of useless procedures that were not going to work in the first place? I have concerns now. How will I know when the firmware update be done? Will I be notified? The other concern I have is. If I have to keep adjusting the setting every time I turn on the TV for a month or year. I'm not going to be a happy customer. Not that am right now. I'm thinking about returning the TV back. And getting a different brand that will meet my needs. So far this Vizio is not meeting the expectations it should. For the money I spent.

Reviews.Title: Not Too Shabby
Reviews.Author: april
Reviews.Content: This is the first "modern" television I've purchased. I love the picture. There is no power button on the TV itself, which kinda sucks since I have a toddler that runs off and hides the dang remote every chance he gets. The apps are cool, I loves me some Netflix and I like not having to buy Roku. Good sound.I'm sure there could be some improvements, maybe a qwerty option to enter searches on the remote. But that stupid thing's going to end up in a weird place that I'll never find anyways. Covered in kid snot.Oh yeah, this is so lightweight! I'm glad I waited so long to buy a TV. I like this one since I mainly stick with Netflix and YouTube for videos and movies and I love the thin frame and not-too-shiny screen. Can't give it 5 stars, since I would have personally done a couple things differently, but I also didn't want to pay more. Nice work, VIZIO:)

Reviews.Title: Description of internet streaming is deceptive. Amazon Instant does not work
Reviews.Author: Alex Hanke
Reviews.Content: If you are ordering this item to utilize it for streaming Amazon.... DO NOT ORDER IT. The APP does not work and according to Amazon tech support it is delayed and it is weeks away from working. I have owned this TV for almost a month and still can't use it. Good picture, but not what it is advertised as.

Reviews.Title: I wanted to like it, but....
Reviews.Author: I M Someone
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like this television. The reviews were favorable by a large majority. The You Tube reviews were fairly favorable as well. So I bought it and I can say that this particular model would have been a reasonable bargain if it were selling for half of what it sold for. The colors were washed out, and looked a little pale in the "calibrated" mode. There were noticeable blur, if not slow motion effects in low light situations in movies and tv programs. There was noticeable breakup (almost a checker boarding) of the picture during sporting events, basketball most noticeably. I wanted to like it because it was a Vizio and 2014 model. I couldn't. The "virtual" 120hz refresh is pathetic. By my experience, its over all quality doesn't match my 32 inch 3 1/4 year old Panasonic Viera, which have disappeared  from the Amazon Market since my purchase in Dec 2010. This was my experience with this set, yours might differ, but in my opinion it isn't worth the price paid. At the time of this writing, the set is on its way back to Amazon for a refund. Amazon is not to blame, Vizio is.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good.
Reviews.Author: Kirstin M. Sampson ""Andy's mom""
Reviews.Content: We just set up the tv today. So far, so good. Sound was just fine, surprisingly. Our living room is 12x22, and we have the tv at one of the "short ends", facing the length of the room. With volume at about 30-40%, it was just fine. Playing youtube videos from my tablet thru the tv was very impressive. In regards to the problem with the stand, and the screws being too short, as mentioned by another reviewer - the screws are NOT too short! We made the same mistake the other reviewer apparently made, assuming that the stand attached directly to the back of the unit. If you try to do it that way, you'll find that the screws ARE much too short. This because the stand is not meant to be attached to the back of the tv. The quickstart guide is not real helpful at this point. We found, purely by accident, a "slot" in the bottom of the tv, that the stand slides up into, THEN you insert the screws into the holes in the back of the tv, and directly into the aligned holes on the stand, that is now inserted into the housing of the tv. Kind of hard to explain, so just look at the bottom of the tv. You'll get it. (Lucky fella, that other reviewer! He complained to Amazon about having to buy longer screws, and got some money back. I'm assuming his stand is now bolted directly to the back of his tv.)

Reviews.Title: Vizio TV
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Morris
Reviews.Content: Great TV.  Love it.  Fast shipping. Picture is crisp and clear.  Easy setup. Size is perfect for my living room.

Reviews.Title: Replaced my old TV with a Vizio everything I needed for my basement family room
Reviews.Author: uwbandmom
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend this TV - easy set-up - step-by-step on screen instructions when setting up for the first time - walked me through setting up the WI-FI connection. Was easy to set-up - very light-weight - carried the box downstairs to the basement and lifted the TV to it's location on top of the entertainment center with ease. Only had the TV for a couple of days but thus far have no issues or complaints. Exactly the size and price I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: I want to even the reviews out...
Reviews.Author: Daniel A. Litvack
Reviews.Content: First off, I am not sure why some of the reviewers are having troubles with the built in apps.  I have used many of them (Amazon Prime, Vudu, and Pandora) and ALL have worked without a hitch.  Perhaps the issues some are seeing are related to their internet service providers and/or router settings.  I am using Wi-Fi and it works beautifully.  Secondly, I find the picture on this set to be sharp, crisp, and clear and I have NOT seen any of the so called "spontaneously goes off very frequently."  Nonetheless, I spoke to a technician at Vizio today and, despite one reviewers comment, there is no "known manufacturing issue" with the particular model.  The only reason I did not give it 5 stars like the first reviewer is because the sound quality is just ok on this set.  I've heard better...but I've also heard worse.  So, for the price, I think this is a good set and I am not certain why some of the reviewers are having such issues with this new model...but I wish them the best of luck!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding TV for the price
Reviews.Author: N. Lahr
Reviews.Content: I picked this baby up at Sam's for $680 plus tax, but without sales tax, Amazon is probably cheaper.First impressions:  Holy crap this thing is light, 33 pounds with the stand, under 25 without it.  The bezel is so thin around the outside, it sometimes looks like the image is being projected or floating in the air, it's pretty amazing.  I did notice that it is glossier than my previous LCD TV, however that was 5-6 years old. It is still matte and it sounds like the glossiness I'm seeing is pretty normal for current LCDs.4 HDMI ports are awesome for hooking up lots of devices.  I haven't noticed a huge difference with the active LED zones.  The 120 Hz refresh rate is an 'effective' rate, so I don't notice much of a soap-opera effect.  I'm indifferent on whether that's a good or bad thing, but maybe it will help with your decision.

Reviews.Title: not smart enough for me
Reviews.Author: Sandy Batt
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv over the others for one purpose, to watch Netflix and Amazon Prime. It came in two days like promised and we tried to set it up. Showed 5 bars for internet but wouldn't connect to Netflix. I had just gotten a new modem router and upped my bandwidth to 20 mgs or whatever. I am not too tech savvy. I had a previous vizio smart tv that didn't work either but someone stole it. they told me the distance from the tv to the router had to be 25 feet or less. that is why I upgraded everything. I even purchased an internet extension but couldn't figure it out. My son and I gathered 5 wireless objects and placed them by the tv. 2 laptops, a smart phone, an iPad and my old kindle fire. they all worked fine and had no problems even further away. I spent an hour and a half with a nice guy on amazon support yesterday and 3 hours with Vizio support today. My tv has been unplugged several times reset to factory settings several times my router has been reset and unplugged and still no service.  With todays technology it is hard for me to understand why something toted as so wonderful lacks the capacity of a kindle fire to pick up a signal. I am going to try connecting it to a fire tv and if that doesn't work I am going to buy a shotgun and blow it up.

Reviews.Title: Buy a new one if you want one of these TV's
Reviews.Author: Michael E Daly
Reviews.Content: After receiving TV, set it up and received 57 channels for 2 minutes, then screen turned multi-colored and picture went blank.  Called Vizio and they had me do all kinds of tests to see if they could get TV to show picture again-no help.  Contacted Vendor for return and must say they were extremely helpful and sent prepaid voucher for UPS the next day.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV at a GREAT price!
Reviews.Author: NP Diver
Reviews.Content: First of all, I purchased my TV at the local WM, and I have NOT encountered any of the problems that the previous reviewers have noticed.  The picture is beautiful and the sound is fine and more then loud enough for a small bedroom.  At first I had a problem with NETFLIX not wanting to stream properly but this was an in-house Wi-Fi problem and was easily solved with the installation of a TP-Link, Power Line Adaptor .Actually, the power line adaptor worked so good that I installed it on all my TVs and computers.For the price this is a great TV with a beautiful picture.  I have been watching the Olympic Games very evening and the picture quality was excellent.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Charlie
Reviews.Content: This is the 5th Vizio LED TV I have purchased. Easy set-up! I am streaming wirelessly and it seems to work great. The only negative is the Vizio Amazon Instant Video App does not have visibility to my Amazon Instant Video list.I am loyal to Vizeo and to Amazon prime, I realize at times prices could be beat, I believe prices are competitive and I enjoy the convenience with two day shipping and a liberal return policy.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, cheap base!
Reviews.Author: James R. Hurtt
Reviews.Content: So far I am completely happy with the TV itself but my bad experience lies within its base and Visio's refusal to provide a new part. It boils down to cheap plastic parts or possibly damaged parts from factory that were not noticed during assembly. The small triangular base connection point broke out the first time I tried to adjust the location of the TV after only having it for a week and a half. The part that broke was the plastic piece that slides up into the TV with 3 embedded nuts in it. I'm sure it costs all of $3.00. I do understand how Visio could right that off to NOT a manufacture's defect, BUT, is a $3.00 part not worth a happy customer willing to recommend their product to others. So, as for the TV, I am completely satisfied even though I've only had it about a month. But I do feel like Visio should take a closer look at the base mounts and re-think their policy over a $3.00 vs a completely satisfied customer that might return for another Visio product.

Reviews.Title: Firmware update and Amazon app finally works 6/4/2014
Reviews.Author: Dkremer
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed since purchase several months ago about the lack of functioning Amazon video app.I arrived home from work last night and turned on my E550i-B2 to find a firmware update notice....  good sign!I went into the app menu and the TV performed an app update check which took a few minutes.Hopeful, I launched the amazon app,  it now WORKS!

Reviews.Title: Great price, great picture
Reviews.Author: C.W.WHITE
Reviews.Content: Never purchased a TV without seeing it work first but this was a great experience. The picture quality is not the very best but pretty darn good. What sealed the deal was that it was backed by Amazon. The home theater system (Sony) we purchased with it was the perfect match... and DirecTV upgraded us to HD for free the day after it arrived. The price and the picture quality combined with free shipping with Amazon Prime made this an astonishingly good deal for us.

Reviews.Title: one bad pixel
Reviews.Author: Jamie Smitley
Reviews.Content: Has a bad pixel.Just one so I decided to deal with it instead of sending back and dealing with the headaches other than that its a decent picture for the price

Reviews.Title: TV OK
Reviews.Author: J. MacDonald
Reviews.Content: The TV is ok. We have it in our kitchen on a hutch and if you are sitting at the level of the TV, the picture is great, if you are standing up and looking down at the TV at all, the picture looks cloudy. We didn't return, but we aren't 100% happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice
Reviews.Author: Texas Devil
Reviews.Content: This Vizio Smart TV is pretty nice. The picture quality is very very good! Having a WiFi capabilities is really great in that there is a lot you can discover. I utilize this with the RoKu device and between the two, I have some really good TV watching. The only negative thing about this TV is it is a lot smaller than I thought it would be. Do not think of the old tube TV 24" and the new LED HDTV's in the same manner. This is not an issue to the point of sending it back or anything, I'm just telling it like it is. :)The sound is loud, "tin" sounding; like someone turned the treble all the way up and the bass all the way down. I have supplemented this issue with a set of computer speakers with bass, and it is perfect!The price was good, I think I purchased it at the right time, as a consumer we always want more for less; and although internally I feel this way, in reality its just right.Hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: Like it
Reviews.Author: Isabel
Reviews.Content: It's a good tv for the price. Image quality is good. You can plug in the HDMI cable to your laptop and see your media content.Also netflix and the rest of the smart contents works perfectly.

Reviews.Title: dark circular hollow shadows
Reviews.Author: Dale D Barnett
Reviews.Content: i do love the tv, but during white or bright background, you see 8 gray shadows in the center, tried every settings but no luck

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: Colin
Reviews.Content: This tv works well and has a nice picture. The capabilities that make it a smart tv work very well

Reviews.Title: Worked flawlessly.
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: I bought this primarily for use as a computer monitor.  I also have it hooked up to cable for TV / Movie viewing.Zero problems.  Perfect quality.  I'd highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great HD TV for a Great Price
Reviews.Author: murphy
Reviews.Content: When I was looking around for TV's VIZIO was not one of the brands that I initially thought of. I was leaning more towards Samsung or LG, but a friend told me that he had gotten a VIZIO HD TV and that it was awesome. Especially because he got it for a good amount cheaper than Samsung and LG. When I got this TV all set up and running. I wanted to see how good it looked in HD. So i turned on my PS3. Turns out my friend was right, the picture looks pretty Ridiculous.  Mass Effect 3 never looked so good. a Couple months after this I upgraded to HD cable, and that also looks ridiculously good. Bottom Line: if you want a HDTV with the quality of a Samsung but at the price point of an LG or less, than this is a great choice. So far i have no problems with the TV. the only thing that was great on this TV was the sound, but that seems to be nearly all LED LCD HDTV's  nowadays so i wasn't surprised there. If this TV is for a bedroom the sound should be sufficient. But if it is for  Rec Room, or spacious living you might wanna think about getting a good sound bar.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Sally "Sally"
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect size for a bedroom. It was easy to assemble and program. Wonderful picture and volume sound quality.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Todd Porter "the snuffy"
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV. Clear picture and love the thin bezel along the sides. Looks really nice on my wall and was easy to mount.

Reviews.Title: Nice performance for the money.
Reviews.Author: ziponein "DDR1918"
Reviews.Content: I found this 55" VIZIO for $698.00+ tax at Walmart today and got it (sorry amazon but it was cheaper). I wanted to order from amazon but money dose not fall out of the sky and I save when I can.Anyway the TV is perfect for the money and dose give super performance once setup was done. I replaced another VIZIO 42" with this one that still worked perfect after 3 years of daily use. The HD performance has come along way in 3 years and the new 55" is way better and dose not let you down. I'm sure you can pay more and get even better performance and picture quality but you have to see this setup right to understand how good it is for the money.Even the sound is right on target with adjustment to your taste and it has plenty of adjustment options for the sound so it's easy to love this thing. I have not found one con with this TV or had one issue at all and would recommend it to anyone getting and new 55" right now.The setup was quick and easy and wireless setup works perfect without one issue right out of the box. Overall I love the TV and will also get the 50" like this next week for my bedroom.

Reviews.Title: A pleased senior citizen.
Reviews.Author: gizz "betty"
Reviews.Content: It is like watching a movie screen.  Very pleased. Glad to have purchased it.  I shall enjoy it very much.  Thank you

Reviews.Title: 2 months could mean nothing to its durability. but it is all good
Reviews.Author: Qiang Fu
Reviews.Content: have not tried customer services yet, but it is the product I would definitely buy again, comparing to samsung as they are at same price.level.only problem to me is the HDMI pot at the back could hardly be used with Chromcast due to the narrow space.

Reviews.Title: Love this Vizio TV
Reviews.Author: AnxtLady
Reviews.Content: I know it's not the 'top of the line' but, it is great quality.The color is wonderful.I also like the settings screens - easy to use (Okay, I'm a girl! :))Like a few other's I noticed, the only complaint is the remote.I'm going to get one with a keyboard.I use  my E5501 tv with the Visio 5.1 surround soundbar.The sound bar is really good.Together, they are fabulous.

Reviews.Title: Very good buy
Reviews.Author: Mariano
Reviews.Content: The price was reasonable and picture quality is great and very user friendly.... the only con is no menu navigation buttons on the TV. Did my research online and I think I received what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: Everything I expected, except that the Amazon app is not there
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Why on earth doesn't the Amazon app work? We're working hard to bring you an updated, feature rich, application.When?Otherwise, the tv is great. Good picture, good apps. Netflix works well, but without the Amazon app, I'm not motivated to even think about buying amazon content to watch on it.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Awesome Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Trina Callison
Reviews.Content: Great TV! The only reason for 4 stars is because the Netflix on the TV doesnt work. They said it was the TV, Visio said it was Netflix. Either way is doesn't work and I had to cancel my subscription and no one could fix it.

Reviews.Title: Vizio
Reviews.Author: Londa Love
Reviews.Content: Works great...no problems whatsoever.  Arrived earlier then expected and it was easy to set up.  I might even purchase another one for my son's bedroom!

Reviews.Title: Nice picture
Reviews.Author: E. Camacho "Consentida"
Reviews.Content: I bought this we always want to see different stuff! Now with this tv and the Netflix, Hulu, You Tube and other apps in this tv, everyone's happy! Absolutely Love It.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: david glover
Reviews.Content: When the TV arrived and I set it up, I was impressed. It is remarkably easy to program. Unfortunately when I turned on the TV, one side of the screen was lighter than the other. So I asked to return it. The response time was amazingly fast. They gave me a link to print out a label and "no questions asked". And they sent me a new TV two days later with 30 days to return the other one. FANTASTIC!Well, after playing a little bit with the TV I discovered I didn't have the power cord inserted far enough. The original TV worked just fine.I'm going to keep both TV's. Because it is such a great TV, I'm putting the other one in my library. This is a mistake that I'm happy I made.

Reviews.Title: tv smart vizio
Reviews.Author: alejandro cuevas
Reviews.Content: thanks is good  tv smart  and good  price  easy to use  im happy  good size  very good  picture  i recommend it

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: R Mac
Reviews.Content: Like the smart TV features....that is why I purchased it. Very clear, sharp picture and very low power usage. I would say this TV is a winner!!!

Reviews.Title: Mixed bag
Reviews.Author: M. Rohlman
Reviews.Content: The picture is beautiful, but it's somewhat sluggish when loading apps and videos.  My biggest surprise was selecting the Amazon app and getting this message:  "The Amazon Instant Video app is currently unavailable while we are working to bring you an updated, feature rich app.  For more details visit amazon.com/video help."  The person I spoke with at Amazon said they don't know when the app will be available.

Reviews.Title: Easy to set up
Reviews.Author: deobrah nicoud
Reviews.Content: Love it... very simple to set up. Picture seems very clear, sound works fine.  Perfect for my use.  No problems at all.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: doxie_pal
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this TV to anyone!! Picture is incredibly clear, easy to use (set up), & the bonus... it's a smart TV.

Reviews.Title: Lovin our new Television!
Reviews.Author: Suzanna Maulfair
Reviews.Content: I enjoy this television not only for its picture clarity but also because of it's "smartness"!I would recommend this television to those who are looking for a step above the rest.Good Job Vizio!

Reviews.Title: First Digital
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: This was my first digital tv purchase and I'm very happy.  Have Netflix subscription and also Amazon Prime member so this is all I watch.  Cancelled my cable tv subscription because I get all the tv I need from my wifi connection now.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV for a nice price.
Reviews.Author: littleefan
Reviews.Content: I do like the TV and it's picture as long as I'm strictly watching TV and not trying to stream.The first issue I had was that I couldn't get it to consistently recognize my Wi-Fi. And when it did see it, it would not connect when I entered in my pass phrase. I turns out that the TVdoes not have a powerful enough Wi-Fi card to work from more than 30 ft away and especially through garage walls. I resolved that problem by using a Powerline Network starter kit that I bought a long time ago but never used.I plugged them in and much to my surprise the TV had a network connection.Now the reason for only three stars: I'm an Amazon Prime member and enjoy streaming from Amazon Instant video. After plenty of research (so I thought) I decided on this TV for reasons other than just price. On of the things that caught my attention was the "AMAZON" button on the remote. How convinient, I won't even need to drill through any menus to start steaming.Turns out, some Visio 2014 models (this being one) are not even able to use the Amazon app. They say that they're working on the app but it the update may not be out until the end of the year.Would have been nice to know.I will post five stars, but only if I get the update soon.

Reviews.Title: Using as Gaming PC / Mac Computer Monitor
Reviews.Author: C. Shorey
Reviews.Content: I use this as a monitor for my gaming PC and my Mac.So far I am extremely happy with this TV, but I thought I would mention a couple things for those that want to use it as a monitor.First off you are going to want to do some decently major calibrating. This tv has so many cool features for manipulating picture and they are all ON by default it seems, and most of them are not needed for gaming or general computer use.  Here is what I did to make it look "correct".PC - Gaming:On the PC I only had to change setting within the TV menu.Picture:Auto Brightness Control - OFFBacklight  60Brightness  50Contrast  45Color  45Tint  0Sharpness  45Advanced Picture:Color Temperature  - CoolBlack Detail  - OFFActive LED  - OFFReduce Signal Noise - OFFReduce Block Noise  - OFFFilm Mode - (I left this one on Auto)Professional Picture: Color Tuner:Red saturation -10Green & Magenta saturation -15(those are all minus)MAC: (I had to do actual color calibration within my mac system settings, and change the color mode to 9300, the one that said was standard for displays & televisions.)Picture:Auto Brightness Control - OFFBacklight  25Brightness  50Contrast  50Color  50Tint  0Sharpness  30Advanced Picture:Color Temperature  - ComputerBlack Detail  - OFFActive LED  - OFFReduce Signal Noise - OFFReduce Block Noise  - OFFFilm Mode - (I left this one on Auto)Professional Picture: Color Tuner:Red saturation -10Green & Magenta saturation -15(those are all minus)Once I had all these settings figured out everything looks amazing. Unless you are going to splurge on a new 4k TV and spend wayyyy more money, I'd recommend this TV.Note:Unless your computer is specifically set up for it, this TV will show up as 60hz, but that's the computer, not the TV. I believe you would need to overclock something on your computer to run anything at 120hz.

Reviews.Title: Needed a small TV for guess room
Reviews.Author: Ron S
Reviews.Content: Needed a small TV for guess room this one is just right for a small room. Sound is fair and was easy to setup on the WiFi.

Reviews.Title: is like the difference between the Toshiba and my last Sanyo ...
Reviews.Author: Justin Paul Rundell
Reviews.Content: Wow! The difference between my new Visio E400i-B2, and my 1 year old Toshiba 32 inch 720p 60hz, is like the difference between the Toshiba and my last Sanyo 27" square tube type. It is going to take awhile, to get used to, just how strikingly vivid this picture is. The sound is very good. I hardly use my speaker system anymore. Even on internet radio.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Rayfern
Reviews.Content: Vizio has well deserved reputation for quality at reasonable price.  This TV does not disappoint. Was easy to mount on wall as weight to size was superb!

Reviews.Title: I love this TV
Reviews.Author: M. Meyer
Reviews.Content: I am upgrading from a 10 year old 100 pound Sylvania plasma that had no HDMI inputs. My upgrade was long overdue. I love this TV and the apps load with no issues unlike all of my Sony Blu Ray players that have struggled to connect to the internet. The remote on this TV is very useful and well thought out. 3 HDMI outs, and all the features plus more than you would expect at this price.EXCELLENT Picture! Unexpected good quality TV sound.My only complaint is that I have signed up for an Amazon Prime trial yet the shipping takes 4 days. I am not impressed with their shipping guarantee so far and their video service is pretty basic. Other than this Amazon is still my go to retailer. I guess I just need to wait for the shipping drones to arrive.***Update***I feel the power cord is too short after hanging it on the wall. You will need some type of extension if you do not have a outlet directly below the TV. Also the power cord mount to the TV is at an angle and is very easily unseated or ( accidentally unplugged).  Also the remote, while I still love it is designed well, I have found that the buttons are tough to depress and are very clicky. Perhaps this is a good this in case you roll onto it as it may not be as easy to press an unwanted button. An illuminated remote would have been very practical too for those with poor eyesight. Power button on the rear of the TV is also clicky and tough to depress.

Reviews.Title: Really Like It
Reviews.Author: Joshua Stukes
Reviews.Content: Fun TV. Really enjoy all the apps and other capabilities. Very satisfied with the picture, sound, and overall performance of the tv.

Reviews.Title: Nice tv
Reviews.Author: PavementEater
Reviews.Content: For the price you can't beat this TV. Very good picture quality. Nice amount of media ports, 3 HDI ports , optical ,USB 2 , coaxial...  I really like that Vizio has added dual band 5ghz Wi-Fi + the ability to connect to hidden / non broadcasting SSIDs.  I am not a big fan of Yahoo web apps  or Yahoo so I personally wish they would have went a different route.  I would have rated this TV 5 stars but I'm subtracting the star because of Vizio's complete failure / lack of a functioning Amazon app...It would be nice if they would let the buyers know that the apps does not work and maybe give out information with an ETA for the app.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: Reese
Reviews.Content: I love this t.v. It is perfect for my girls room.  They can watch Sponge Bob day in and day out.  It has a connection for your DVD player through an HDMI or an antenna for local channels. It also has a feature for surround sound in the menu settings.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy with this TV
Reviews.Author: Mark King
Reviews.Content: Our old monitor was looking dull and a tad blurry so we ordered this because we have liked Vizio products in the past and the price here on Amazon was almost $100 cheaper than Walmart.The sound quality from the internal speakers is weak in bass, not a problem for us because we use a small set of Bose speakers for sound.Our signal source is an Apple Mac Mini, we feed the Vizio with a 10' HDMI to MiniDisplay Port cable I bought here on Amazon, the picture looks fantastic. Netflix, Amazon TV, iTunes and DVD's look great. The monitor adjusts it's brightness automatically and we're happy with the performance so far, we get up and party in the middle of the night, it's nice that the monitor does not turn on at full brightness for sleepy eyes.The remote control is compact and easy to use.This is my first SMART TV and IMO it's not that smart because the apps are slow, much slower than the Mac Mini we normally use. You push the Netflix button and it takes a while for the set to get it up onscreen, navigating around in Netflix is also slow using the built-in smart TV. Netflix-HD LOOKS amazing on this monitor running through the smart-TV native app, lines are noticeably sharper and less pixelated than the Mac Mini video output on the same HD program. It is nice that the Vizio has the smart apps, it gives us more viewing options, we can have the Mac doing other tasks like compressing video while watching a movie using the built-in Smart TV apps. Generally speaking we prefer the speedy performance of the Mac as a source rather than the built in apps, we consider those to be "included free", but they were not a real consideration in the purchase. Price, picture quality and size were our main buying selection criteria.The trim around the perimeter of the monitor is very compact, I love that, it is not trying to be fancy, instead it's compact and understated in appearance, perfect for our viewing room.Overall we're delighted, no funny noises from the power supply, it was easy to unbox and set up, it's light weight so it's not hard to move. My little bit of griping about the apps being slow is nothing in the grand scheme here, I paid this much for a high quality computer monitor a few years ago, now you get 40 amazing LED inches for a bit less $$, now is a great time to consume TV.

Reviews.Title: Great little TV.
Reviews.Author: Kel C "KC"
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome TV for the price.  With built-in wireless it's a nice little TV that fits my space perfectly.  It's in the kitchen under the counter attached to a wall (keeps it off the counter top) using a $15 Cheetah mount.  The sound is good for a built-in speaker system.  I don't need surround sound with a sub-woofer in the kitchen.  The Cheetah mount allows it to swivel to be viewed from the table or from the cooking area.  Good to watch the news or Wheel of Fortune while I cook.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure about the quality when I ordered this because of LED's but I love It. Comes in clear and bright and LED's last a long time. The features included like netflix is also good to have. I would buy this again if needed.

Reviews.Title: Was about to return this....BUT
Reviews.Author: BO S YANG
Reviews.Content: Upon initial use, the TV was extremely SLOW to remote commands and I even had it shut down on me (too much info to process?).  I had initially thought I made a grave mistake and had it all boxed up set to return.  However, since I had time to burn, I decided to retry it only this time, I removed ALL apps except for Netflix and YOUTUBE, which are the only two apps I use anyways.  This small change made the TV 1000000 times better!  I can only conclude that this TV has a very weak processor/memory and sensitive to multiple/various apps.  Netflix now works great and there is almost no delay in commands.  YOUTUBE still suffers some lag and searching/typing is still a pain but at least its tolerable now.  Other than the delayed commands, the picture is great but there is a great deal more glare as compared to my Sharp/Sony I had prior.

Reviews.Title: Content with the TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this on sale from Target and included was a $30 gift card.  Easy to setup and picture quality is crisp and bright. Before purchasing I made my research and concluded that the price relative to the screen size this Vizio model was a good deal.  Full array LED, Active LED zone x6, 120 mhz  and WiFi features are definitely plus qualities.

Reviews.Title: A great hdtv for the price
Reviews.Author: Nathaniel
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my 40" TV, and have not regretted it. The picture is better and the refresh rate is really nice. I am a gamer and tend spend a lot of time looking at the screen, so having a high refresh rate helps when online and things are moving quickly. The answer I can't seem to find is whether or not the smart remote with qwerty keyboard works with this model.

Reviews.Title: Amazing first HD tv
Reviews.Author: overly happy
Reviews.Content: Amazing and easily set up. The picture is great, super bright just a wonderful Smart TV. The price was right and it came in a quick and orderly fashion.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: john holme
Reviews.Content: After changing a few of the factory settings the picture is excellent. I didn't particularly care for the factory settings and changing the factory settings was no big deal. The sound is great as well. Was watching a movie and could hear a clock ticking loudly which I never heard with my previous tv. The tv was extremely easy to set up and also adding my blu ray player and Roku 3 was a breeze. I'm glad I decided on this one over the Samsung, Sharp, Phillips and Sony

Reviews.Title: the vizio tv
Reviews.Author: Matt Parrinello
