Amazon could at least cover the box with some kind of paper to prevent the world from knowing I now own a 40" TV.  Any one could have stole it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: val89052
Reviews.Content: I'm very pleased with our new smart TV, watching movies on Netflix and Youtube has become so much easier (compared to using a Roku unit). The only thing missing was a keyboard remote, which I had to buy on ebay.The image is incredibly clear, the colors vibrant.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a good price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoy this TV very much. We bought it for a vacation home and didn't need a huge, super special etc. etc. However, we were surprised how nice this was. We can watch Hulu+ and Netflix on it easily without using another device, and the picture is very good. My husband did add a sound bar to improve the audio, but we only use it for movies or music.We're quite happy with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good price, good TV
Reviews.Author: veneff
Reviews.Content: The TV arrived when promised.  That's important because we had to sign for it.  The TV was simple to hook up and the picture looks good.  I haven't had a chance to play with smart features as yet.  This TV fit in the same space as 40 inch TV because the surrounding bezel is so thin.  It is so light, I was concerned with its hardiness, but so far so good.  Connection to our wireless network was easy.  Thus far, I'm happy with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: Got it quick. The packaging was on it's original package. The picture and sound looks good with all my HD equipment.

Reviews.Title: 5 Stars
Reviews.Author: PRAM
Reviews.Content: I am giving this 5 stars. I realize it is not the best image you can get out there, but I am amazed with the image quality considering the low price (I believe around $698 after my Prime discount). I have it on an articulating corner wall mount and it looks fantastic.  The Smart TV is very convenient if you like to watch Hulu and Netflix.

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: Jenn
Reviews.Content: This is my first full-size flat panel TV...yes, I know I'm super behind! A friend of mine helped me do the research (he owns several Vizio's and other brands); he highly recommended this one since I was looking for a smart TV.  I don't have cable TV, so I use an antenna for local channels combined with the netflix and hulu TV apps (no problem with those two apps).  I agree with the other reviewers that the remote is pretty lame and I had low expectations!  That said, I love the TV, but my next TV will probably be a "dumb TV" and I'll use chromecast (already have one!) or ROKU.

Reviews.Title: Best Budget Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Jared VanMeter
Reviews.Content: This was my first smart TV and I have to say I love it!  I installed it in my basement where I don't want to buy another cable box.  The wireless works flawlessly and the streaming is awesome.  The interface takes a little bit to get used to as does finding the master channel list on the remote!  Once you have that down the TV is fully at your disposal.  I would highly recommend this TV to anyone that is looking for a decently sized smart TV for a great price.

Reviews.Title: great job
Reviews.Author: Donna Moffo
Reviews.Content: I cant believe that not only was the price better than walmart. but with no delivery charge, and they set it up in my house too, walmart wouldnt have done that, without a added charge, amazon is amazing

Reviews.Title: Got this for my mom
Reviews.Author: Graham Quigley
Reviews.Content: Got this for my mom and she loves it! Really nice, the sound is good for her, I wanted one with decent volume and this one has it. As of now, it's the most modern Visio TV in this price class... Has the dedicated netflix button, makes viewing easy for her.

Reviews.Title: Good value, not a great picture.
Reviews.Author: Jeremy M. Mulvany
Reviews.Content: Was somewhat disappointed in the lack of vibrancy in the picture quality.  Tried to adjust settings to make it better and it just doesn't seem to be anywhere near as crisp as my older TV's.  I will keep messing with it, but not sure it will get any better.  I suppose you get what you pay for in this price range for a smart TV.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and fairly easy to set up
Reviews.Author: Lee "Have been an avid reader all my life. St...
Reviews.Content: Picture is great.  Nice and bright.  Set-up was easy once I found the User's Guide on the TV.Would have give it 5 stars but am not happy with remote sensor location at the extreme lower left side of the unit and the remote has to be aimed directly at it for it to work.  Placing it in the center would make it a lot easier to use since either end may be blocked by someone or something.Amazons delivery was great.  Make sure to follow their instructions.  The guys that delivered it did try to get us to accept it unopened.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Donal Fagan
Reviews.Content: I have two of these now, and both were easy to setup and connect and use. I like having one remote to do everything instead of streaming thru the bluray player.

Reviews.Title: Great buy for the price!
Reviews.Author: Al
Reviews.Content: Went with the Vizio because of the features and price.  Priced under $680, we couldn't find anything close feature for feature.  Setup was easy.  The TV connected to our WiFi with no problem.  We have streamed movies via Netflix with ease.  We have Amazon Prime.  Unfortunately we are awaiting a software update so we can use the Prime without our XBOX.  The tv itself offers a great picture all around.  Our family room has great light which can wash out a picture.  The Vizio LED handles the bright room and delivers a great picture.  In low lighting the picture is very good.  The only thing that caught our attention was the corners we a tad dark.  It didn't take away from tv viewing.  If I could make one suggestion to Vizio, the remote feels somewhat cheap.  We only use it for the SMART TV function.  All in all we are very satisfied with our purchase and would definitely recommend the tv.

Reviews.Title: Great Flatscreen and with WiFi
Reviews.Author: Roger Mayer
Reviews.Content: Great flat screen with wifi. Good daylight and lowlight picture. Extremely easy to set up. Don't need a computer or tablet to Internet movies or music.

Reviews.Title: Bargin
Reviews.Author: Francis J. Hess
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a perfect second TV.  Good picture,not bad sound.  They do need to get an Amazon app though.

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: Devin Guillory
Reviews.Content: This TV has a beautiful picture, although you may want to tweak the default color settings.  It has plenty of apps, but I will say that amazon prime on vizio stopped working about 2 weeks after we bought the TV and it still does not work.  I use my XBox for this though so it isn't a big deal.  I like the thin border around the screen and I've been very impressed with the sound quality.  Great TV for the price!

Reviews.Title: Overall great TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: I was in the market for upgrading my old Vizio 32" 720p TV from 8 years ago. I always liked the vizio brand with the quality that TV produced so figured I'd upgrade to the latest model Vizio with the smart TV features. After reading many reviews and different forums, I decided with the E550i-B2 and Amazon had a nice deal on it (Only buy it from here if it's sold by Amazon, the 3rd party sellers are $150-200 more.)Everything arrived in prefect condition. The delivery people were pretty good about turning the TV on to make sure everything was working before leaving. The setup on the TV was easy, picture calibration is easy. Netflix works flawlessly on it, no lag or anything weird. I even installed PS3 media server on my computer and the Multimedia app on the TV picks up the media server and I can stream video files straight to the TV from that!The only downside I've had so far is the sound. Because the speakers are behind the TV it sounds a little muffled and just isn't good audio. It's not terrible, but it's not good either. I'll probably invest in a sound bar to go with it. Also that the Amazon app still isn't ready for it yet, not sure why that hasn't been resolved yet.Overall, I think it's a pretty good buy for the price and would recommend it!After a couple of weeks of having the TV, I've settled on these picture settings:Auto Brightness: OFFBacklight: 100Brightness: 50Contrast: 90Color: 55Tint: 0Sharpness: 50Advanced Picture Settings:Color Temp: NormalBlack Detail: MediumActive LED Zones: OnMotion Blur Reduction: OnReduce Signal Noise: OffReduce Block Noise: OffFilm Mode: AutoA big thing to keep off is the Reduce Signal Noise. It makes the picture really bad for HD programming. Like a photoshop paint filter.

Reviews.Title: Vizio Is For Real!!!
Reviews.Author: G.W. Brown, Jr.
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up and get situated in your home.  Unlike most people, I've still got an entertainment center and this TV takes up the entire space allowed...which was our plan.  It was quite a welcome addition to our home - upgrading from a 27"...lol.  Absolute solid value and fantastic picture for the money.  Had it for a couple of months now.  So far, so good, no complaints...on the picture.  As many others have commented, the sound leaves a bit to be desired.  However, that can quickly be corrected with a high quality sound bar and speaker system.  Overall, I cannot say enough positives about Vizio.  Thank you Amazon for the good deal and 'thank you' to all your customers who posted previous reviews which greatly assisted our buying decision.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture Out of the Box
Reviews.Author: Thomas A.
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up.  Only negative is that you can't turn the screen without turning the base. Very pleased with the picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a good price!
Reviews.Author: James Kohn
Reviews.Content: Worked fine out of the box, no apparent "break in" was necessary. Excellent picture with natural colors and intensity. I played with picture settings but ended up with just a few tweaks to the Calibrated preset. I'm running the sound through a 5.1 sound system so can't comment on the internal TV sound. I live in the boonies so my DSL downstream is just adequate but the wireless connection has no problem streaming videos. It's fairly simple, also, to link my iPad for navigating Youtube videos and avoiding doing that with with the remote.But still no Amazon streaming, a bummer especially, being a Prime member. C'mon, Amazon, there's even a button for it on the remote!!!

Reviews.Title: Very, Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Ellen Jeffers
Reviews.Content: LOVE the very clear picture and the audio is also WONDERFUL.  The only fault I can find is technically my own . . . I wasn't clear on what a "smart" tv was & thought I could access the internet, etc.  I don't use many apps (don't even have a iphone) so was a little disappointed with that aspect of the unit but I understand that it's not the fault of the company or the tv itself.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: JOSE BRENES
Reviews.Content: Affordable user friendly with excellent picture quality. Easy to set up and apps to access internet content are at the tip of your fingers.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Michelle Smith "smithinapex"
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV for the price!  The sound and picture and features are fantastic.  it is very light and easy to mount on the wall.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Stoner
Reviews.Content: Great picture.

Reviews.Title: good buy
Reviews.Author: Melanie Foster
Reviews.Content: Picture not as good as I hoped, just OK. Love the easy smart TV functions. Easy to mount, thin looks great on wall. Sound is also better than expected. Great price.

Reviews.Title: great value tv
Reviews.Author: William J
Reviews.Content: arrived when promised through primegreat tv for master bedroom - excellent picture out of the box, lightweight & easy to install, largest size available to fit existing 200x200 mounthaven't tried smart features

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV,,,Great picture
Reviews.Author: Jeff Webb
Reviews.Content: Hard to beat for the money. Small chassis, very light. Lots of features. Easy setup . Very intuitive. Nice and bright.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value
Reviews.Author: Carole Ladendorf "car and e."
Reviews.Content: If I could give this product 4 1/2 stars, I would. The menu is easily navigated, and while the settings out of the box are pretty good, to get the best out of this TV, you'll probably want to tweak them a little. There is plenty of contrast, while retaining detail in the highlights and shadows. I don't know how it could be a better picture.I watched a baseball game, and there were 2 announcers. There was something about one of their voices that made the speakers sound " tinny". The other sounded fine. Background ( fan) noise made it difficult to hear the announcers. The good thing is that these problems were easily fixed by tweaking the audio settings, making the audio definitely acceptable, although not perfect.This set has been measured as best as I could to be 27 feet from the wireless router. There is a wall and a sofa between the router and TV. The first time I tried to stream content from Amazon prime, it took a little longer than I expected to begin. After the first few minutes, it was smooth sailing. I also have a Roku hooked up to another TV, which is about 10 feet from the router. I doubt very much that the Roku would perform as well as this wireless that is built-in to the TV, although this has not been tested.I have only had this TV for 4 days, so time will be the judge on longevity.I was not able to give 4 1/2 stars on performance, and I also can not give more than 5 stars on value, which I would if possible.

Reviews.Title: Good TV but no web browser app.
Reviews.Author: Supershrimp
Reviews.Content: I would have given this TV five stars had it had a really good web browser. Its lazy and lousy on the part of vizio that they have not developed a good web browser app with flash and html5 support. Also if you want to play something from the laptop the input instructions are not clearly given. Samsung has a good web browser app and you can lay lot of web videos that are not on youtube.

Reviews.Title: SATISFIED
Reviews.Author: sheri
Reviews.Content: I am not electronic savvy but this TV has lived up to my expectations.The price and size sold me. I think that my Samsung had a better picturewhere I didn't have to mess with the settings. If you mess with the picturedisplay you can get a great picture. The shipping was on and came in withNO beat up box. The weight is light and thin side view. Plus it is A SMART TV.

Reviews.Title: this is a great tv for the price
Reviews.Author: Michael B. Vederman "dead mike"
Reviews.Content: My large 51' rear projection TV with 'lifi' bulb that was supposed to be the end-all-be-all, was replaced 3 times over 5 years (under warranty). It finally broke and I got this as a replacement and it is even lighter than the other tv and it is insanely thin! The picture is amazingly sharp and bright. So far so great.

Reviews.Title: Finally Updated tlo 21st century
Reviews.Author: Dossain S.
Reviews.Content: I was trying to update my picture in picture 32 in flat screen TV that had served me well for more than 10 years, when i first purchase it then it was the top of the line, brand new took a shot well years later history to repeat itself. Enter VIZIO new company for me so i took a chance again. Well just as the first time so many years ago it worked i even both 2 this time a 42 and 32 very good investment .This 42 has a small foot print the colour fits my decor perfectly. everything they said about it was correct it works well for us. The smart TV is plug and play even remembers what is plugged to it that is cool the picture is very nice rich the action is very good the sound is good,(ordered a sound bar and sub woofer to replace my outed home theater system ).This is a very good product well built the WIFI is very good no need for extra cables the graphics for PS3 Cable TV, and DVD is very good.sound is good also even with an old sound system, bought i second on of the same company before this one arrived.I have it mounted on the entertainment center it fits great rotate left and right, such a good product i know use it also for my PC monitor how that for big screen. I have recommended both to my friends and family . This was and is a very good product.

Reviews.Title: my first flat screen
Reviews.Author: Dossain S.
Reviews.Content: well been shopping fr a TV to upgrade mine since have not done it in 10 years plus, the modern era is here.I went online a lot reviewed a lot of TV and a lot of stores.VIZIO is a company never heard of much but they seem good enough.I like this TV because it is compact nice styling leaves a small foot print the colour is cool looks as a piece of art fits my room my style.the features are easy to use the TV is a smart TV and sure it is my components is-plug and play, good for me.i shopped other brands but for price service and what they showed this was a better deal.had this for a few weeks now and use it almost over day there is always something new i discover .this product fit my need and beyond my expectations, i deal with electronics all my life tech is my friend so i was very happy with this product.  I was so happy that before i purchase this one 32"  I purchased  the 42". Took a long shot and it worked both are great products

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect
Reviews.Author: George Bailey
Reviews.Content: Now that the Amazon Prime app is operable, I can easily upgrade my rating from four to five stars. I like everything about this set.

Reviews.Title: Very please with the quality of the screen. The ...
Reviews.Author: Thomas F. Witwicki
Reviews.Content: Very please with the quality of the screen.  The internet software works well with Netflix, but I'm still waiting for the Amazon update.

Reviews.Title: Love my new tv
Reviews.Author: Niesa Turner
Reviews.Content: I so love this smart tv it's more then what I imagined. Will be purchasing another one in a few weeks.Ps love the apps

Reviews.Title: Love , except for Prime
Reviews.Author: Lori
Reviews.Content: This tv is a great purchase for the money! I am very happy with picture and sound. Easy to set up also. I am disappointed that I can't watch Amazon Prime.

Reviews.Title: Very good for the money
Reviews.Author: Steven D. Smith
Reviews.Content: Amazon Prime does not work with it even when I plugged in a 100' cable from the router to it.  Remote is very cheap but I love the TV otherwise for a very good picture and I do not regret the decision to purchase it.  Could not afford anything better right now.

Reviews.Title: Super
Reviews.Author: Vish
Reviews.Content: Awesome And brilliant !! The tv is lovely and the picture is amazing, vizio is the best in market and it matches with the tvs of 55 inch

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Thomas Maluk
Reviews.Content: Beautiful TV. Wonderful picture, easy set up, the audio through the TVs speakers is much better than our older Toshiba. We only use our surround sound system for some music or special movies, but this TVs speakers give everyday viewing a touch of surround sound. This is our first smart TV and now our Roku is in our sons bedroom. Netflix at the touch of a button as well as u-tube and other internet apps. We also do not get Amazon Prime Video but hopefully firmware issue will soon be resolved. Overall- We Love It. Never buy a "dumb" TV again.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: John Smith
Reviews.Content: Great picture, great price, hooked up to my wifi no problem.The remote is a little sluggish (why skimp on the remote, c'mon Vizio)... and there doesnt seem to actually be an amazon instant app out for it yet, even though there is a button for it on the remote.For the price you cant beat it, and the very thin frame makes it look very high end.

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: Daniel G. Rogers
Reviews.Content: So far it has performed well. There may be a question about one of the HDMI ports according to the cable installer.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Dartshuter
Reviews.Content: Very Nice TV  ! Vizio is a great product at a hard to beat price if you need a new tv hard to make a bad buy with a Vizio.

Reviews.Title: Love the tv but the wobbly stand. Poor stand support.
Reviews.Author: Savon K.
Reviews.Content: The stand looks as if it does not do its job, the tv wobbles a lot put it where there is less shaking or you can get a wall mount. I must say that this is a great tv for this price. The pictures are extremely vivid and crisp. The downside is the remote you have to hold directly at where the power light at the bottom in order to gain control and also for when you first set up the tv remember to click on HOME not STORE, I had to reset the entire tv. This tv is very bright and also senses the light in the room and automatically adjust the level of light on the screen.Note for network interface: I  would highly recommend using a Ethernet cable instead of the built in WIFI, I find that some of the app freezes when on WiFi.

Reviews.Title: Sound issues
Reviews.Author: Robert H.
Reviews.Content: The features available on the vizio product are amazing and generally easy to use. The access to amazon instant movie account or netflix account was easy to set up and is easy to use. the picture quality is superb. The only issue I have had with the TV is sound, the sound seems to go up in voulme and clairty and then randomly reverse to lower sound and quality, I have a 42" Vizio also and havent had this problem.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: jonas1015 "jonas1015"
Reviews.Content: Got this TV for my bedroom and I'm very happy with it.  Love the Netflix button and all the rest of the little goodies that it has.  I would definitely recommend this TV to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Vizio - Kind of Value
Reviews.Author: Jake Pusch
Reviews.Content: Picture quality - A+Ease of Use - ASize - A+Smart Apps - CSynopsis - This Vizio HDTV is best described as best overall value for an LED, high quality flat screen. The picture quality is best in its class. HDMI ports are easily accessible. This Vizio HDTV was a great practical investment. I would highly recommend this TV to a consumer with a "best bang for buck" mentality. Though Samsung leads the market, Vizio offers a better solution for value

Reviews.Title: Wonderful for the bedroom!
Reviews.Author: Barbra J Pompeo
Reviews.Content: I have this same Vizio tv in the living room (except it's a 47"). I love it so much that when I needed a new one for the bedroom, I knew this was the one for me.  32" is plenty big when in bed.  The sound is great- the picture fantastic. Especially in the vivid mode. Set up fast and easy. Have watched numerous Netflix movies and many many UTube videos.  No problems whatsoever. Price--unbelievable. I love this Vizio.  It also was delivered so fast and free shipping!!!  This tv is GREAT!!!

Reviews.Title: Faulty TV With A Blown Speaker
Reviews.Author: Patrick Donahue
Reviews.Content: After much research, we decided to buy the 2014 55inch Vizio. TV looked pretty good out of the box, but after minimal use, we discovered one of the speakers inside the TV was blown. Very disappointing. Amazon is sending a replacement.IF this TV was working perfectly, it would be a 5 star review. But shipping faulty TV's is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: very good value.
Reviews.Author: Wes Hartman
Reviews.Content: I usually buy Samsung but was looking for a more cost effective LED for another home.  looks great. sound is what you would expect from a TV like this so I got a soundbar which makes a big difference.  I would recommend this to friends.

Reviews.Title: big screen
Reviews.Author: Danny L. Collins
Reviews.Content: first smart TV for me and I love it. I plug it into modem and you can watchnetflix and you-tube with same remote. also video gaming is so much bettera great buy

Reviews.Title: Not terrible
Reviews.Author: skn
Reviews.Content: The unit doesn't have all the apps I would have liked. but i guess i should have done more reasearch. Plays well and looks great no complaints

Reviews.Title: Won't turn on
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: after having this tv only a few days I was already having problems with it not turning on. I have had it abit a month now and it has gotten better but I'm still not happy with it. Randomly when you try to turn the t.v. on it freezes and won't go on or off with the remote or with the button on the side. The only way to get it to turn off is to unplug it. I contacted Vizio about this and they just told me to unplug everything from the t.v. and reset it. I don't have anything plugged into it. Overall I love the t.v. minus the fact that I have to unplug it randomly to get it to work.

Reviews.Title: Buy this smart TV
Reviews.Author: julius c mckenzie
Reviews.Content: Good TV for the price I would recommend this product to anyone looking for a good smart TV good product

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: LilTreyyy
Reviews.Content: Even for a not so big T.V like this it shares about the same features as the bigger sizes(inches). Great T.V

Reviews.Title: A Great Looking TV That Had Too Many Issues For Me
Reviews.Author: Reds Fan
Reviews.Content: I SO wanted to like this television. I fell in love with the very thin bezel and the picture (in the store). I also loved the SmartApp-dedicated buttons on the remote (no more having to talk my wife through changing inputs, etc.). I have no desire to "bash" this product, and I very well may have taken home a lemon unit, which I chose not to exchange. Your mileage may vary, but I can only attest to my experience with this television (that I purchased at a local shopping club that rhymes with clams).Once home, I struggled with what seemed to be one thing after another. Having already gone to the trouble of mounting the TV to our bedroom wall, it was with great angst that I decided to return it a week later.Here are the issues I encountered, ranked in order of my priority, from least to most:- The universal wall mount holes are very bottom-centric, meaning they're situated from the base, up to the center of the TV. If you mount this using a full motion bracket, it feels really "flimsy" on the mount (for lack of a better term) when you try to move it about.- I read spec.s and reviews to the contrary, but the viewing angles we experienced were terrible. Even slightly off center viewing resulted in an extremely washed out, ghost-like picture. Our bedroom is rather large and has room to either side for viewing the TV. This just didn't look very good at all from anywhere but the center of the room.- The IR sensor at the base of the TV is entirely too weak. I've seen others write about this issue, and I can certainly confirm that it's really bad. It often took several frustrating mashes of the buttons to perform any function. I experienced the same poor reactions using our DirecTv remote, which confirmed it was the receiver and not the remote or poor batteries. While on the subject of remotes, I would add that the loud "click, click, click" noise from all of the remote buttons was rather annoying to listen to and conjured up some not-so-great memories of the old "channel changers" of the seventies.- The final straw was the wifi connection. I had no trouble seeing or signing onto my 50MB wireless LAN. In fact, the TV would consistently show 4 out of 4 bars for the signal strength. However, I couldn't get the TV to maintain the connection for more than a few minutes at a time - ever. I tried for hours with their customer service help desk, but we never were able to identify or fix the issue.I realize this is a newer model, and I think Vizio's features, cost, & value ratios are spot-on in this series. I really hope that they can correct most or all of these issues with firmware updates (none were available when I checked). As I said, I really struggled with deciding to return this TV, but I did. I replaced it with another, 2 letter, brand for roughly the same price, and having installed the replacement, I have to tell you that it was hands-down the right decision.

Reviews.Author: worseone
Reviews.Content: Okay got this "55 Vizio tv 2014 model. So far I am very happy with the overall sound and picture quality. I havent had any wireless issues like other reviewers have mentioned. Wireless signal is strong and works great. Perfect streams no lag or buffering of any sort. There are only three  things Ive come to notice wrong with this TV:1. The remote control- very hard to navigate within the apps. Buttons are not that responsive. I find myself pushing the bottons more than once. Typing in keywords i.e in youtube or netflix is a PITA. Too fustrating. Be prepared to hate your remote after a few searches. I have a PS 3 so I use that to watch movies via netflix/amazon.2. The Blacks in idle mode- when the tv is in 'no input' detected mode, the screen is black. Ive noticed the screen kind of blotchy, meaning there are lighter blotches of black within the black. Not an even black across the screen. It only looks that way when 'no input" is detected.3. Lighting around bezel edge- When you look at the screen from the side I did notice lights coming through the bezel. It maybe the cause of the slimmer bezel. Nothing distracting but kind if weird you can see the tv led lighting showing through when viewed by side (its rare you will ever watch tv on its side).So overall the TV is great!!! I would recommend the tv to anyone looking to upgrade. Ive played BF 3 on it without any input lag. The tv is very responsive to input when playing online. Very light, volume is great, and picture quality is great.

Reviews.Author: Chestr "Chestr"
Reviews.Content: Summary: I bought this TV as a cheap replacement for my workout room.  And that's exactly what this TV is, a cheap replacement.Pro's -1. Price.  Not cheap, but not too overpriced relative to the specs.2. Speakers.  I can hear this TV clearly from ~20 ft. away while on the treadmill.3. Size.  While 42" isn't exactly a large TV by today's standards, it does fit nicely in the space I have available.4. Bright.  This TV is very bright at the default settings which is perfect for the room I have placed it in.5. Refresh rate.  The kids hooked up their XBox and there wasn't any ghosting.Con's -1. Picture.  It's not a bad picture, just not as good as my Samsung (best) and LG (better) Smart TV's.2. Apps.  Why bother integrating wireless into the TV if it doesn't include a DLNA player?  Just for Netflix?3. Apps.  As others have stated, the Amazon Instant Video app does not work.4. Apps.  They're all pretty much garbage (compared to my other smart TV's).

Reviews.Title: Don't bother if you want the smart apps.
Reviews.Author: M. Kane
Reviews.Content: Great picture, horrible apps. I will admit, I am a Roku fan. I'm used to effortless and consistent operation of my TV apps. I bought this TV as a secondary, and chose this one for it's reputation for picture quality and so I wouldn't need to buy a second Roku. The picture quality is great and sound is about what I expected, but I have had nothing but trouble with the apps. The remote has an Amazon button on it, but it just shows you a screen that says the Amazon Instant Video App is currently unavailable. Netflix regularly looses my account login information, and two days ago it quit connecting to the Netflix server completely. What a piece of junk. I could have gotten a larger screen for the same money, or perhaps a better name with Working Apps for a few dollars more. This is my first and will be my last Visio purchase. I also burned myself by buying at a big box retailer... I can't even return this stinker.

Reviews.Title: It died after 6 weeks
Reviews.Author: Marianne
Reviews.Content: Amazon is going to refund us but this TV just completely died after only 6 weeks. Up until then we were happy with it. No more Vizio's for us.

Reviews.Title: Broken Already!
Reviews.Author: K.A.CHRISTIE
Reviews.Content: Purchased this on 3/14/2014, and already is broken. Second TV sent out due to broken screen. Now the controller is broken (no control buttons on television) And the SMART part is just plain STUPID! Netflix rarely works, and Amazon Prime does not work at all. With a 30 day warranty not sure how this is going to work out since I haven't even made the first payment yet.

Reviews.Title: CAREFUL: Good TV. May NOT work with Amazon Prime
Reviews.Author: Joey
Reviews.Content: Interesting.. I complained to Amazon's leadership that their ad was misleading because it states that the TV works with Amazon Prime, but they currently have the knowledge that it does not (FYI: other 2014 models are also affected). Then, days later, a note on the top of this product page stated that Amazon Prime was not working. But now, I have come back a couple of weeks later for my review, only to see they removed the heads-up to the consumer (and the issue is not resolved as of 4/11/2014).So, as for the quality of the TV itself.. I would say the malfunctioning app, false advertising by both Amazon and Vizio (and in addition, their childish finger pointing games at each other).. these things are enough to bring this down to 3 stars.With that said, Amazon provided me with a work around option.. Simply because of servicing me as a customer, I felt obligated to not bump this down to 1-2 stars. Outside of this, I'm sure it's a good TV.. but I'm a cable cutter (only using Amazon Prime), thus the TV was a brick to me till they made it right.I feel obligated to inform others since Amazon took it upon themselves to reverse their decision of notifying their customers. It seems to me it was a blatant move to hide these issues.. which appears was in favor of selling TVs?I'll update this review when it is confirmed resolved. Keep in mind, this is the case for all 2014 Vizio models. You can follow the thread of all the others impacted at the link below.. Many 42, 55, 60" TVs.. 2014 models.. all affected.Filtered by newest posts -http://www.amazon.com/forum/amazon%20video%20on%20demand?cdForum=Fx3EQAX98ED5WQ3&cdPage;=1&cdSort;=newest&cdThread;=Tx12ES76FR1SBJP

Reviews.Title: You better have REALLLY fast internet
Reviews.Author: Megan
Reviews.Content: The picture was pretty decent for the size but sound quality was so/so. The biggest issue I had with it is that only one app worked which was Netflix. For some reason only Netflix worked and all the other apps wouldn't recognize my internet connection. Also, according to the instructions you needed to hit the "Via" button on the remote to get the app dashboard to pop up but that didn't work either. I was told by tech support which is all scripted.....that i didn't have fast enough internet even though I could stream Netflix movies just fine. I googled these problems and found that this problem has occured several times with these smart tv's.

Reviews.Title: if you hang it on the wall, the knob that fits into the stand does not come off
Reviews.Author: Holly Aufmann
Reviews.Content: The tv is fine, picture good, but the knob under the tv that fits into the stand does not come off if you want to hang in on the wall. so when you hang it on the wall the knob is hanging out. Not good. Called Vizio and they said the only way to get the knob off is to take the whole back off the tv to unscrew it and then it would not be under warranty. I find this ridiculous when the tv can sit on a stand or hang on the wall. Would really like to send it back but seems like to much trouble.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture but freezes up in WiFi! Problem may be across other models as well!
Reviews.Author: E L
Reviews.Content: When I initially bought my TV, the picture was great. However, I began to have problems with the TV where it would freeze up. After sending the TV back in and having the wireless card replaced, I found that the TV still has the same issue, freezing up to the point where you would have to turn the TV off and back on again. After multiple hours of time spent with customer support, I was told that there was an incompatibility issue with my wireless network such that it caused the TV to lock up. I was told that I would have to either disable my WiFi network (then what would deb the point of an internet TV) or disable the Network or File sharing function of my WiFi network. I was also told that it may have something to do with how the TV is not DLNA compatible. I have a standard out-of-the-box network from an Apple Airport Extreme, nothing fancy. I wouldn't know how to set up anything fancy with my network anyway. I spoke with Vizio by phone and email more times than I care to count. I was hoping to exchange my TV for a model that would not have the WiFi issues, but apparently I am told that all their TVs have the same WiFi card AND MAY BE SUBJECT TO HAVING THE SAME LOCKUP ISSUE! I was told that I am not alone in having this issue. So while having to deal with repeating the same story over three months to various support reps, getting the voicemail of a manager who takes over a week to return a voicemail, overall I have to rate the whole experience of owning a Vizio as abysmal. I'm still trying to troubleshoot the issue with a different manager, who has shot down my proposal to exchange my model for a newer one in the hopes that it resolves my WiFi issue. I guess, we'll just have to see...

Reviews.Title: When running netflix app tv turns off
Reviews.Author: Jenn Allen
Reviews.Content: This tv was bought for our 4 year old primarily so she could watch netflix. After setting it up the pandora app worked perfectly but the netflix not so much. Won't even run for a full min before the tv just s***s down. We set the Wii back up to the tv and have the same issue it just turns off. Our son has a vizo that is a year old that hasn't had an issue with the netflix app. Will be contacting amazon tomorrow. After reading reviews I would not purchase this tv.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price.
Reviews.Author: goblin boots
Reviews.Content: Great for the price. This is a slim device, with very narrow bezels compared to other devices in this price bracket. Amazingly, you can control the TV's Netflix and YouTube apps from your Android or iOS devices just like you would with a Chromecast.Only complaints so far are:- The "smart" interface is very slow. For a 2014 product, this really should not be an issue, no matter what price bracket. I'd happily pay an extra $50 for a more responsive interface.- Cheap-feeling remote control. Very lightweight, but not in a good way. It's quite chunky, and feels rather hollow.- I would have liked a second component input for some older consoles that don't have HDMI output.

Reviews.Title: STILL SUFFERS FROM HDMI SIGNAL LOSS, LIGHT BLEED & GHOSTING/CLOUDING!!!
Reviews.Author: AMERICAN RIFLE
Reviews.Content: Hello Amazon Customers,For the record allow me to state I was the "Amazon Verified Purchase" owner of 2 edge-lit VIZIO E500i-A1 Televisions that I purchased in December 2013, and eventually had to return back to AMAZON.COM for the exact same reasons that plague and affect this Television model, the newly introduced for 2014 VIZIO Full Array Local Dimming(FALD) E500i-B1, which I will try to describe in full detail below. This model was introduced in between Mid January/Early February 2014 over at Costco and available right now at VIZIO's main website. PLEASE TRY AND REFRAIN FROM BEING A FANBOY, I give you my word I am being as honest and objective as I possibly can be and I am giving you the most accurate detailing that I can provide. This review is from my personal experience with this TV set.I recently had the opportunity to go and stay over at the home of a friend for a period of 3 weeks who had purchased the 2014 VIZIO FALD E500i-B1 and was allowed to familiarize myself with this set in it's entirety. First allow me the pleasure of telling you that the picture quality regarding the brightness, colors and contrast levels of this Television in comparison to the edge-lit E500i-A1 can go from far better to absolutely astoundingly and astonishingly drop dead gorgeous when given the very best calibration possible. I used the  Spears & Munsil HD Benchmark and Calibration Disc 2nd Edition BLU-RAY disc that I own to calibrate the TV.I have also used the calibration disc on my own personal TV and it is a superb calibration disc in terms of the results you can achieve with it by DIY and it's price in comparison to a professional calibration job.HOWEVER THAT IS NOT THE REASON I AM GIVING THIS SET 2 STARS.I am giving this Television set 2 stars because it is plagued and affected by the exact same issues that destroyed the experience for me with the 2 edge-lit E500i-A1's that I previously owned, and also affected the edge-lit E601i-A3 and the E701i-A3 that I also personally witnessed happen(THIS HAPPENED SO MUCH THAT VIZIO FAMOUSLY ISSUED A RECALL ON BOTH TELEVISION MODELS). The issues being the Television would lose the HDMI Signal every 5-15 minutes for 3-5 seconds and then the Picture would return, interestingly You could still hear the audio, The HDMI INPUT PORTS in question are 3&4. The other issue is that it still suffered from very minimal edge light bleed, and yes FALD displays can still suffer from edge light bleed. For example in the edge-lit M601d-A3R as well as this new for 2014 FALD E500i-B1 if you look up close carefully along the edges you can see some of the light bulbs. That is due to Subpar Manufacturing Practices, essentially the panel placement methods aren't as best as they can be, in the case of the E500i-B1's light bleed it has nothing to do with it being a FALD display, although light bleed is more pronounced on edge-lit displays, light bleed isn't due to a display being edge-lit it has more to do with the method of manufacturing. There are currently many edge-lit and FALD displays that have absolutely zero light bleed. The last issue is also rather bothersome and disheartening that it plagues this model just like the edge-lit E500i-A1, and that is the occasional ghosting/clouding. It happens often enough that it is going to be very noticeable with certain and frequently watched programs.IN CLOSING.....Ladies and Gentlemen, at this point these issues have to be attributed to POOR VIZIO QUALITY CONTROL substandard parts and careless manufacturing Standards & Practices. Remember 3 other models have been plagued and affected by these exact same issues that I can personally attest to witnessing, the edge-lit E500i-A1, E601i-A3, E701i-A3 and finally the "new for 2014" FALD E500i-B1. Personally speaking I am honestly not able to tell you if this affects other 2014 E-series models but I definitely can attest to dealing with this problem on this E500i-B1 model during my extended stay at my friends home. The idea that this is still happening in the year 2014 among VIZIO E-Series Televisions is quite alarming and should give any potential customer a momentary and cautionary pause because clearly THE QUALITY CONTROL OF THE E-SERIES PLAIN AND SIMPLY IS STILL NOT THERE. In my personal opinion It is rather unfortunate because as described in the second paragraph the Picture Quality when properly calibrated can be astonishing for the price, however the PQ in this television does not make up for the very serious and noticeable issues that still plague the E-Series line. VIZIO's very slow firmware updates can only do but so much to improve things. In my experience firmware updates can introduce or take away features and can even improve certain software faults, but historically HDMI signal loss and Light Bleed are a faulty hardware(HDMI inputs) and build quality problem(Light Bleed) that a firmware update simply will not be able to fix. A firmware update might be able to address the Ghosting/Clouding issue, but based on VIZIO firmware update history, then it is a high probability the issue will  NOT BE RESOLVED as illustrated and proven by the edge-lit E500i-A1, E601i-A3, E701i-A3 that I can personally attest to witnessing and other E-Series & M-Series models that are still dealing with the issue.If you are definitely interested in the new 2014 50" VIZIO models then you should wait for the 50" VIZIO 1080p M-Series M502i with 32 zones of FALD local dimming expected to cost $729.99USD or the 50" VIZIO Ultra High Definition P-Series P502ui with 64 zones of FALD local dimming expected to cost $1000.00USD or under. The M-Series has been known to be "slightly better" than the E-series in terms of build and picture quality. As far as the new for 2014 P-Series is concerned, there isn't any reliability, build or picture quality testing data available, but a year of availability on the market should hopefully provide some by research labs like Consumer Reports as an example, but as far as the P-Series is concerned, it is expected to be the better of the 3 model lines when available according to the "Professional Reviews Media and Press". Otherwise I would skip VIZIO until vast & definitely needed Quality Control and manufacturing Standards & Practices improvements are introduced amongst the E-Series model line. If you don't care about frequent HDMI Signal loss, Light Bleed and Ghosting/Clouding problems then by all means get this Television set. At least you can say "the Picture Quality is good for the price". Once again so unfortunate for a TV with great PQ.I usually do not consider an extended warranty in regards to TV's to be necessary, but given VIZIO's history, if AMAZON offers an extended warranty please do consider one for your own peace of mind. Thank You potential AMAZON Customers for taking the time to read this Customer Review.**UPDATE**April 5, 2014This model is now available at VIZIO's main website as well as Target and it's website.**UPDATE**April 17, 2014Improved the details and fixed typographical errors.This model is now available at TIGERDIRECT's main website.**UPDATE**April 25, 2014More improvements to details and fixing of typographical errors.Now available by some "AMAZON RESELLERS" over $150.00USD extra dollars. Please don't succumb. The VIZIO MSRP of this model is $599.99USD and is sold by AMAZON at $599.99USD and eventually will be in better stock supply and/or rotation in the weeks ahead by all major retailers. Most major retailers are trying to sell/get rid of their edge-lit E500i-A1 model stock before they introduce the 2014 FALD E500i-B1 model stock.**UPDATE**April 29, 2014This model is now available at Bestbuy and it's website.

Reviews.Title: BUY A DIFFERENT TV LEMON!! Random Reboots, Loses netflix login, hulu login, and amazon login. Had 3 replacements sent from Vizio
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: These TVs are LEMONS. I have had 3 replacements sent to me to try and resolve this issue that is clearly a software issue or a problem with their mainboard. While watching tv via the apps like netflix, or hdmi on a bluray, the tv will reboot itself. The screen will go dark, the white status light in the bottom corner will come on and the tv will boot back up to the blank input screen. This will wipe the login information to netflix and sometimes hulu and amazon. I was concerned this could be an issue with power in my brand new house so I hooked it to a UPS. It made no difference, the issue still occurred.The first tv that had this issue upon calling Vizio had the mainboard replaced by an onsite tech. The problem still occurred.The second tv they sent was a refurbished unit. This one had the same problem. Upon calling Vizio they said they would send a brand new non refurb unit. She then promised me that if the issue occurred again, they would send a different comparable model.The Third tv has the same issue. I called today to have them send a different model and the phone tech said they wanted to send a tech onsite to do diagnostics. I informed her that the last tech that was here observed my setup and said there was no reason why my environment would cause this issue. She said that they wont send a different model unless they come onsite to do this. AGAIN. I asked to speak to easily one of the WORST most UNPROFESSIONAL Managers I have ever spoken to. He constantly would interrupt me, telling me this is an issue with my environment and not their under-engineered, poorly tested, vaporware tv's.  He said he would not honor the last customer service representatives promise and would put in for a request to refund me and I have to wait until Monday for that approval. He said that if it wasn't approved, they would have to send a tech to seek out an environmental cause. I used to be a huge vizio fan. I have a lcd tv of theirs that has had no issues for over 5 years. This experience with this tv and that awful manager have turned me off to this brand forever. Save yourself the headache. Find another brand that values their customers and continued business. They will NEVER get mine again.

Reviews.Title: Great while it lasted
Reviews.Author: maemurphy "maemurphy"
Reviews.Content: Have only had this television for two years. It's dead.Cost of repair is greater than the cost of the television. I could swallow that if it weren't TWO YEARS OLD.Will not buy this brand again.

Reviews.Title: I love this television
Reviews.Author: Benjamin D. Risik
Reviews.Content: I love the tv, but the only complaint I have is that the speakers could be better. other than that its great

Reviews.Title: Good picture
Reviews.Author: Amber T. McGinnis
Reviews.Content: Clear, nice picture. Easy to use for my senior dad. This is also a good size - not too big and not too small.

Reviews.Title: Not for me!
Reviews.Author: Alex King
Reviews.Content: So-so pix looked nothing close to advertised 10M-1 dynamic contrast ratio, not to mention Web browsing is not supported on this so-called Smart TV, and AMAZON Prime access is not possible (AMAZON advised they are "working on it").  Stand is unstable, TV could easily be tipped over by child or household pet.  Large disappointment, returned to AMAZON for refund.

Reviews.Title: thin, light, high tech, great ... speakers sound a little tinny
Reviews.Author: Joe Smith
Reviews.Content: For a small TV, these have come a long way. It's HD, has intuitive menus, easy to use remote and all the modern ports (HDMI, etc.) The display looks bright, colors rich...The on-board speakers are a bit tinny, but that's going to be pretty typical with an ultra-thin, super-light TV. (The thing can't weight 2 pounds... I'm sure the weight is listed, but it reminds me of propping up my iPad.) Maybe a small speaker set is required for more bass return...Overall I'd highly recommend it. For the price? A+

Reviews.Title: Not great...but will do.
Reviews.Author: Savo Fries
Reviews.Content: I chose this TV for a specific spot.  Should have gotten one size larger.  My fault.  The TV is OK .  But, not great!  Have to turn the volume way up to hear it.Should have spent more money and then maybe I would be able to say "Love It"

Reviews.Title: 42 inch TV
Reviews.Author: David Geyer
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with my purchase. Looks great and has great picture quality. It was easy to install and setup was also easy.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E320i-B2 32-Inch 720p 60Hz Smart LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: TV worksApps load slow if your comparing them too your smartphone or computerPicture quality is ok, some channels are worse than othersVideo gaming is ok, some scenes on this TV turns a reddish/greenish colorSound is goodSome of the buttons on the remote aren't quiet, they make a clicking soundI own a Apex 32-inch also, and I'm much happier with the Apex.The Apex has much better picture quality, it doesn't change colors when video gamingThe Apex has more component hook-ups, the remote is extremely quietOut of 5 stars, I give this Vizio TV 2 starsApex 32-inch 5 stars

Reviews.Title: Not worth the savings
Reviews.Author: Pixie 401
Reviews.Content: I figured I'd go for screen size and would make do with the picture quality, knowing I wouldn't be getting a Samsung-like picture.  First TV I got, I could not get a good picture regardless of whatever preset setting I chose.  Tweaked and tweaked. Called Vizio and they determined there was something wrong with the TV.  I shouldn't have to make such drastic adjustments.  Their customer support was great, by the way. They offered to exchange the TV but I decided to return it to Amazon since I had it less than 30 days.  Amazon replaced it within a couple of days (can't beat their customer service, UPS picked up the TV).The second TV's picture was better - it was adjustable.  But I still had to make such drastic adjustments with the presets.  Would get a good picture on one HD channel, switch to another HD channel and I'd have to adjust the picture again!  I just could not get that crisp clear picture you should get from an LED TV.  My Samsung LCD 720p had a far better picture.  I guess you could get someone to come in to calibrate it at some extra cost, which defeats the purpose of buying the low price TV.  Or get one of those discs people talk about - I don't have a blue ray player so that was not an option for me.The unit is solid, though very plasticky.  Stand wobbles.  Positive thing about the TV is that it is very easy to set up.  Didn't like the remote - buttons too small, plus you have to point it directly at the TV, and I mean directly, otherwise nothing happens.I watch a lot of TV and there were too many cons to contend with.  I returned the unit and spent extra to purchase the LG 47LB6300 which has turned out to be quite perfect.  Chose one preset setting, adjusted the color and have not had to touch it since.  Crystal clear picture.  Deep blacks, sharp lifelike picture.  No fussing.Maybe I got a dud with both Vizio's I tried.  My friend has a Vizio and the TV has a great picture.  This TV has gotten good reviews which was why I bought it in the first place, so maybe it was my luck.

Reviews.Title: I recommend going for the 1080p version.
Reviews.Author: Chuck Bittner "Disabled comedian & gamer!"
Reviews.Content: At the time of writing this review the 1080p version of this TV was less than $100 more. And I would recommend getting that as really 720p televisions are kind of outdated. Plus it has a 120MHz refresh rate which is twice as fast.Here's a link to the 1080p version: VIZIO M321i-A2 32-Inch 1080p 120Hz Smart LED HDTVI'm somebody who likes to future proof is investments so spending a few more dollars and getting a better TV Is what I prefer. Hope this helps thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: Wanted to like this, but weird color issues made me send two back
Reviews.Author: M. Campbell
Reviews.Content: **Edit: Pictures of color bar oddities now posted in customer images.**I read the reviews, liked the specs, and was excited that this was the latest 2014 model with a fast processor and 6 active zones for better black levels. I really, really wanted to like this TV.However, I had big color calibration issues. With my Roku3, my main device, they were major. Fleshtones were incredibly red and other colors were also way off. None of the built-in picture modes corrected this (Calibrated Black was my baseline, since it was supposed to be very good right out of the box). I tried manual adjustments. I tried a factory reset on the TV. I pulled up the color bar test patterns in the TV, and saw that the white/yellow bars were green, and all the other colors were off too. Weird!I emailed Vizio and sent them pictures of the color bar patterns, but all they could suggest was a power cycle and a factory reset, both of which I'd already done. Assuming I got a dud, I called Amazon tech support and arranged a replacement. TV #2 had the same problem. Noooooo!!! Then I tried the color bar test pattern on my Blu-ray player, and it looked just like it should. What...? I unplugged the Blu-ray and plugged in the Roku3 (same TV input, same calibration settings, same HDMI cable) - weird color problems again. Then I swapped in my old LG television - same Roku, colors are fine.Emails to Roku's customer support resulted in finger-pointing at the TV, since it works fine with the LG. Vizio likewise doesn't believe it's their problem. Unhappy with the clown colors on every show, I reluctantly decided the second set had to go back.The big plus was how good Amazon's 30 day tech support is. They picked up right away late at night, listened to the problem and what I'd tried to fix it, offered smart advice, and ultimately great support for the return including UPS pickup. Although they won't give free returns if you just don't like the TV, it's nice to know that if something is really wrong they're very willing to accommodate, not once but twice.

Reviews.Title: Its a great tv but...
Reviews.Author: Ryan And Matt
Reviews.Content: I walked into a big*box store and found a 32inch for the same price  I paid for this 28.NOT HAPPY, WHAT IT IS IS WHAT IT IS....

Reviews.Title: Very poor sound quality!
Reviews.Author: S. Fussey "Headtechie"
Reviews.Content: Ordered the 24" for our bedroom, as we are moving our older (5ish years old) 23" Vizio into our office. The picture quality was ok, nothing spectacular, but then again, its a $179 24" TV. It's thin, light, fits nicely where we need it to fit. Does not tilt.....My biggest grip.....the sound is terrible. It sounds like an old single speaker car stereo. It sounds very hollow, tinny. I really would not recommend this TV. I am disappointed, as I have bout 4 Vizios now, liking each one more and more, until this one.Also, the smart TV portion is only ok as well. I have one TV with a new Apple TV and one with an XBOX 360, which each work much better and faster then the Vizio software and system. The remote isn't very nice to use either. I couldn't get it to pair with my Comcast STB. I can't stand needing 2 remotes.Over all, I wound not recommend this TV. Not at all.

Reviews.Title: tv matrix failed in 4 days
Reviews.Author: Michael Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: Tv had a great picture. I was pleased until day 4 when the screen would make just about everything on the screen green! I was told the matrix had failed Vizio was good about working to have a replacement shipped . It did take about 10 days. I guess in todays world of microcircuits, anything can go wrong . So far so good. I did buy the extended warranty Overall I would recommend it and the price of the  tv, it pays to get an extended warranty, just in case.

Reviews.Title: Love my Vizio
Reviews.Author: Lavonne Phillips
Reviews.Content: No complaints!! My Vizio is all that and a bag of chips....I couldn't ask for more, I absolutely love it!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV smart aspects SLOW and Flaky
Reviews.Author: Christopher Spence "Lucky Dad"
Reviews.Content: For the money this TV looks awesome.  But using any of the smart apps (specifically netflix) is about as fast as an IBM XT and frequently locks up the TV (only fix is to pull the power plug).Get it for display quality, stay way if your a big netflix user.

Reviews.Title: Slow wireless connectivity
Reviews.Author: JP
Reviews.Content: This was my second try with a Smart TV (first one a Samsung that had network connectivity issues and was glitchy).I had hoped for a more positive experience here, but that was not the case. While the TV would easily find my network, I could never get a stable, high-speed connection. Doing a Speedtest on my iPhone standing next to the TV, I’d get 20 Mbps download. On the TV, it ranged from 384k to 4Mbps (on rare occasion). As a result, the picture quality streaming from Netflix was unacceptable. I also experienced the random TV shutdown issues with Netflix that others have described.Even more concerning, I also discovered that the TV would interfere with my wireless network. To the point that when I was using it, my whole home’s network speeds would slow to a snail’s pace. I'd Turn off the TV and things were back up to speed.So, in the end, two failed attempts at a “smart” solution have led me to go with a not-so-gifted (aka "dumb") TV paired with the ever reliable Apple TV.It just seems like Smart TVs are trying to do too much too soon. Maybe one day.

Reviews.Title: ONLY $398.00 at WALMART.
Reviews.Author: Randy Y.
Reviews.Content: Great TV, color is very nice. I would have given it 5 stars but getting the internet is a bit tuff.

Reviews.Title: So far, no good.
Reviews.Author: Smiles
Reviews.Content: First problem was the picture quality.  It took a couple of days but we were able to figure that out.  Next problem, the smart tv features do not work well. Even though we have never had problems accessing netflix on our much larger set, it never works on this one---even if the rest of the house is unplugged from the internet.  I thought i'd hold off on sending it back til i could arrange it to plug directly into the wall  BUT, just my good fortune, 31 days after purchase, the volume starts going out.  Not a happy customer.  Will see how customer service responds.

Reviews.Title: Wouldn't buy this one
Reviews.Author: Ronald Lee
Reviews.Content: Trouble with volume and sound control. Would not purchase this tv again given my experience with these volume issues. Increases and decreases volume on it's own

Reviews.Title: Good picture but doesn't work with Uverse Wi Fi
Reviews.Author: Douglas Lach
Reviews.Content: This TV has excellent picture quality, especially for the size and price... BUT when connect it via WiFi to my home network it freezes up and will not accept any inputs. When I dosconnect it from WiFi it works fine. I called Vizio and explained the problem, and they told me I need to turn off file sharing on my modem. The problem is, I have AT&T; Uverse, and the modem is owned by AT&T;, and I cannot control the settings, WHen I explained the situation to AT&T;, and asked them to turn off file sharing, they explained that they could not do this, at least not without disrupting the service for my wireless set top boxes (and DVR). I like this set enough that I'm going to return this set and replace it with the same Vizio 32" set without the wireless features. If you don't have Uverse, it might be fine as is.

Reviews.Title: Although this unit has a decent picture, what it's missing is what truly concern me, The Digital Audio Out (SPDIF) was removed b
Reviews.Author: JEM(Jaden E Michiko) "JEM"
Reviews.Content: Although this unit has a decent picture, what it's missing is what truly concern me, The Digital Audio Out (SPDIF) was removed by the people at Vizio in this model, also out is one of my favorite Apps, The Amazon Prime Instant Video App, does not work on this model, also their is no AppStore to download any new Apps from, so I cannot connect this TV to my so round sound system Digital Audio In (SPDIF), I cannot watch Amazon Prime Instant Videos, and guest what, for loosing all these features, you get to pay more, I am sending this unit back, and I am purchasing the older model, which is a real Smart TV, with my favorite apps, actually working, oh yes the Amazon App is actually on the remote, but when you click on it, you get a sorry message! I need my TV to work as Advertised!

Reviews.Title: It's okay
Reviews.Author: THENAJONES jones
Reviews.Content: STAND NOT STABLE

Reviews.Title: Vizio E241i-B1
Reviews.Author: SRS
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV for my kitchen.  It worked fine until my window to return it closed.  Now, when I turn the set on, everything is green for about 10 seconds with no volume.  I will contact Vizio to see if there's a fix for it which I am sure will be a nuisance.I will update my feedback after contacting Vizio.

Reviews.Title: Quick and easy....but
Reviews.Author: Richard Braddock
Reviews.Content: After ordering and being assured of a timely delivery, Amazon again stepped up. Arrived on time and in great condition. Setup was easy. It actually took longer to unpack than it took to start watching. Haven't gotten to the wifi yet as my router does not reach this room. Ordered a repeater to cure that issue. TV picture quality and sound are very good. I don't think I will have any issues with them. Remote is small and I have large hands. My Dish remote will replace theirs. If there is anything negative about the Vizio it is the mounting base. What a cheap and rocky piece of junk! The seven screws that hold everything together are too small and will not tighten enough to keep the base from rocking back and forth. I will probably wall mount and throw the base away. Deduct a star for that!

Reviews.Title: Some issues with used Vizio E420i-BO 42 inch smart TV
Reviews.Author: Karl W. Dorff
Reviews.Content: My slightly used Vizio arrived in good shape except for the fact that a tiny bit of some kind of fuzz (from clothing probably) was in the screen when the TV was assembled.  It is rbarely noticeable except for times when it shows up on people's faces or it is sliding down the basketball court.  I don't see it as enough of a problem to go through the hassle of exchanging it.  Also, the sound quality, picture quality, and remote control are not nearly up to the standard of the 32-inch Sony Bravia that I passed on to my wife.  That is to be expected when comparing Vizio to Sony.  The process of ordering and receiving the television all went quite smoothly.

Reviews.Title: Very nice for the price.
Reviews.Author: Cory Grimsley
Reviews.Content: I got this T.V. specifically for the great price.  It has done very well for me.  The only thing I am critical about is the Multimedia app has problems navigating the music from my PC.  I also would like to have had HBOgo available to me on this model, but apparently Vizio does not have that capability at the moment.  Otherwise, the picture is great and navigation of the apps/features is very easy.

Reviews.Title: No buttons! One that seems to be power button but does not work!
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline Windhorst
Reviews.Content: Good picture, have not been able to access the smartness of tv, only because I do not have internet at this time. I am concered that there are no buttons on tv, if I lose my remote im pretty much screwed..for this reason I considered returning but just don't want that hassle eitherO. Frist time I ordered something this large and expensive from Amazon may reconsider this kind of purchase from a brick and.morter next time.

Reviews.Title: good promise, bad execution for Vizio 42 inch "Smart" TV
Reviews.Author: kd5yzo
Reviews.Content: The price point, the promised apps and the possibility to access Amazon Prime made this Vizio TV an attractive choice. When I got the TV, I was pleasantly surprised that it was light but not cheap-looking. The colors are bright and the sound is robust.The reason for three starts, instead of five:1- The promise of access to apps via their interface is a farce. Unless you have at least 3mb per second internet speed at all times, most of the apps will not work. Unfortunately, I have spotty internet, despite a very good wifi modem, and I cannot use any apps except for Netflix. This fact is a testament to Netflix's very successful and customer-centric business model.2- The promise of an Amazon Instant Video app is a fail. Despite their repeated comments on efforts to get it updated, whenever I call tech support, they tell me to call Vizio. This is ironic, because Amazon claims Amazon is working on an upgrade; however, when you call, they say "call Vizio". The onus is on Amazon, as it owns the software and the Video Service.3- The remote, that cheap looking one, broke 5 days after the 1-month mark of the purchase.While the TV itself is good as a stand-alone, look for somewhere else if you want to access Amazon Instant Video or other apps, except for Netflix.

Reviews.Title: Great in Theory
Reviews.Author: R A in WI
Reviews.Content: Bought it at Target for streaming Netflix, and Prime.  After having it turn off randomly dozens of times in the first 2 weeks I did a google search and found other reviews here having same problem.  Love the idea of a smart TV but just not this one.  If you want it for Netflix it is not the right TV.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv!
Reviews.Author: MA
Reviews.Content: Great tv, very easy to use and I couldn't ask for more for the price. I am a lover of Vizio

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Kobi Fryman
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this purchase. Great picture and quality TV. Ordered just the right size. No more squinting to see the picture.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, great price, hope it lasts.
Reviews.Author: Tanner Dance
Reviews.Content: It's a good TV with lots of options.Cons: The picture is decent, could be better though. I have an LG 5400LN and the LG has better picture quality than the Vizio IMO.  Perhaps there will be an optimum picture setting in forums to come, but I haven't found any as of late.Pros:Great price/valuedecent remoteslim

Reviews.Title: Summary for my 55" Vizio TV
Reviews.Author: Ray Clatterbuck
Reviews.Content: I like the set ,it has a very good picture however the speakers are a very weak subject.  I wear hearing aids which help me to hear as well as most people but I still have to have a tower next to my recliner.  My wife hears real well but says she heard what was said but couldn't understand the result.  RayC

Reviews.Title: price perfect
Reviews.Author: Keith paul
Reviews.Content: It's a good size for the lounge in my house perfect picture for the price but stand could be a little more stable. I would definitely purchase it again.

Reviews.Title: Completely satisfied
Reviews.Author: Opal "Opal"
Reviews.Content: The TV is everything I have wanted and so much more....I am enjoying every minute of watching TV now. it is a total new experience for me...I love it

Reviews.Title: Awesome Vizio!
Reviews.Author: Michael Wildasin
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome TV! Worth the money compared to other more expensive TVs. Great picture, just have to adjust to your liking. I did a lot of research before purchasing TV and it was worth it!! Buy one!!

Reviews.Title: fault advertisement for the yahoo and facebook part
Reviews.Author: Frances K.
Reviews.Content: I am disappointed that the yahoo and facebook does not open up full screen.  There was nothing on the box or when reading about the stats that it didn'e open full sacreen.  Though it has a good picture and I do like it otherwise.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: David Gullickson
Reviews.Content: This TV is quite a steal from Vizio, and while I can still tell a difference in picture quality between the 70" Sharp a family friend has, this comes darn close at a much, much lower price.  A very good upgrade from the old 32" Samsung I have for my primary TV.The built in smart apps work well, and I love that I can control them and find videos to watch on Youtube and Netflix with my smartphone; the keyboard on my phone makes it much easier than scrolling to the letters to type on the TV itself.  I do notice a little slowness on the apps, but not enough to make me lower my rating.Overall if you are looking for a smart TV and don't want to spend over $1000, this is probably a great deal for you.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: Sam G
Reviews.Content: The first thing I noticed when plugging this TV in was that there was a buzzing sound coming from the rear of it when it was not powered on. I am not sure if it was a problem with the TV I received or all of them.Picture Quality to me seemed washed out no matter what I did with the settings. This was to replace a 32 inch Vizio (NV320) from a few years ago which has a great picture. This one was not even close in quality.The sound on this TV is also not good. I understand that you're not going to get super high quality sound from such a thin TV, but this sounds like the sound is coming from a coffee can.Your're  getting a lot for the price here and as long as you don't care about Picture and Sound Quality then you might be happy.I returned mine to Amazon and ordered the Samsung UN32EH5300 which is a better TV in my experience.Amazon customer service is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: best tv ive ever owned
Reviews.Author: RON
Reviews.Content: for the price you cant go wrong with this tv picture is crystal clear tons of features definitly buy this tv

Reviews.Title: Nice with some concerns
Reviews.Author: Tony Hill
Reviews.Content: Nice tv with a good picture and decent sound.  It has all the apps that I actually use almost daily. It loses a couple of stars because of Vizio's privacy policy.Read it and decide for yourself.[...]When you interact with VIZIO, we may collect personal information relevant to the situation, such as your name, mailing address, phone number, email address, and contact preferences; your credit card information and information about the VIZIO products you own, such as their model numbers, serial numbers and date of purchase; and information relating to a support or service issue - the "Personally Identifiable Information." For example, we collect Personally Identifiable Information when you register a VIZIO Product or Service, access certain V.I.A. Services, contact us for warranty service or customer or technical support, enter a sweepstakes or participate in promotions and giveaways. From time to time in the future, we may offer additional products, features, services and promotional opportunities that would require you to submit Personally Identifiable Information to VIZIO in order to participate.We also collect "Anonymous Information" such as your IP address on certain VIZIO products, your ZIP code, the hardware and firmware version of your V.I.A. Services capable product, and the V.I.A. Services you visit, as well as information about your VIZIO product such as MAC addresses, product model numbers, software versions, chipset IDs, and region and language settings. VIZIO will also collect specific viewing information (as described below under the heading "Smart Interactivity"). We also collect Anonymous Information regarding customer activities on our websites, V.I.A. Services, and VIZIO's Internet Store. Some Anonymous Information may be associated with Personally Identifiable Information.VIZIO also uses "cookies" to collect information when you visit VIZIO's web site. A cookie is a small data file that VIZIO transfers to your computer and is stored on your hard drive. Cookies are used by thousands of web sites in order to enhance the web site experience. When you visit VIZIO's web sites, the cookie identifies your computer to us so that you do not have to re-register each time you visit. We also use cookies to anonymously measure the traffic to our site and its different services and features. VIZIO recognizes that parents, guardians, or other adults often purchase our products for family use, including use by minors. We will not knowingly collect Personally Identifiable Information from children under age 13 for any purposes nor will we knowingly accept registration from them, but because some information is collected electronically, it can appear to be the Personally Identifiable Information of the VIZIO purchaser of the product, and will be treated as such by this Privacy Policy. If a child under age 13 submits Personally Identifiable Information to VIZIO and we learn that the Personally Identifiable Information is the information of a child under age 13, we will attempt to delete the information as soon as possible or take any other measures required under applicable law.Smart InteractivityCertain internet-enabled VIZIO Products and Services may include a feature enabling VIZIO to collect information from your product and to trigger events based on that information (see below for a description of the kinds of information VIZIO collects). Such events may include pop-ups on your screen to provide further information about what you are viewing and may include advertising. This feature is generally known as "Smart Interactivity." VIZIO will track and collect the information related to Smart Interactivity (described below) in a manner that is consistent with this Privacy Policy.When Smart Interactivity is enabled, VIZIO will collect specific viewing information, including but not limited to the identity of your broadcast, cable, or satellite television provider, the television programs and commercials you view (including time, date, channel, and whether you view them live or time-shifted), and whether you click on any advertisements.You will be afforded the opportunity to disable and opt-out of Smart Interactivity directly from the menu of your VIZIO products.
