For example, if you sign up for our email newsletter, we will send the newsletter to the email address you provided. We will also use Personally Identifiable Information to send you information about products and services that may be of interest to you, from VIZIO and our third party partners. However, we may also initiate communications for other reasons including the above purposes, such as support, purchases, and information requests, using the Personally Identifiable Information in VIZIO's possession. You will always have the opportunity to "opt out" by unsubscribing or otherwise decline to receive further communications. Later on in this Privacy Policy, we provide you with more information on how to view, modify or remove your Personally Identifiable Information.We use Anonymous Information to determine how people use the VIZIO Products and Services. For example, this data tells us information including how often users click on advertisements, which files are downloaded most frequently, and which V.I.A. Services are the most popular. Analyzing this data allows us to improve the offerings on and performance of VIZIO Products and Services. You may not elect to block VIZIO's collection of Anonymous Information.How we share informationWe work with third parties in connection with V.I.A. Services and with some aspects of the VIZIO Products and Services, such as delivering content, processing payments and providing warranty or marketing assistance. These companies may help us process information, extend credit, fulfill customer orders, deliver products to you, manage and enhance customer data, provide customer service, assess your interest in VIZIO Products and Services, or conduct customer research or satisfaction surveys. Without such Personally Identifiable Information being made available, it would be difficult for you to purchase products, have products delivered to you, receive customer service, provide us feedback to improve the VIZIO Products and Services, or access certain services, offers, and content on the VIZIO website. When we supply Personally Identifiable Information to these third parties, we require them to use it only for the function or purpose for which they are working with VIZIO.We aggregate Personally Identifiable Information and Anonymous Information that we collect and exchange it with advertisers and other partners who are interested in the use and performance of the VIZIO Products and Services. We share this information so that our partners also may provide you with an optimal user experience and better understand how users access the VIZIO Products and Services.We will disclose Personally Identifiable Information as required by law, or if in our judgment it is necessary to protect VIZIO or our employees or users from harm, loss or liability. If we merge with or are acquired by another company or we sell substantially all of our assets, the acquirer or resulting company will receive and may continue to use the Personally Identifiable Information you have provided, and the Anonymous Information gathered as described in this Privacy Policy.How we protect informationVIZIO will maintain the confidentiality of the Personally Identifiable Information that it collects. VIZIO maintains internal practices that help protect the security and confidentiality of Personally Identifiable Information by, among other things, limiting employee access to and use of this information. When you provide VIZIO with information such as credit card numbers over the Internet, we encrypt your transmissions using SSL ("Secure Sockets Layer"), and other industry standard security technology. We keep the Personally Identifiable Information you provide on servers that are protected by firewalls and employ other industry standard security measures designed to prevent intrusion or unauthorized access. However, VIZIO does not guarantee that Personally Identifiable Information will not be disclosed to third parties for conditions beyond its control, such as third parties that circumvent security measures to unlawfully intercept or access the information.How you can access or remove your Personally Identifiable InformationIf you desire access to view, correct or remove your own Personally Identifiable Information, please contact us using the following contact information by emailing [email protected] or calling 877-698-4946. If you request removal of Personally Identifiable Information, you acknowledge that residual Personally Identifiable Information may continue to reside in VIZIO's records and archives, but VIZIO will not use that Personally Identifiable Information for commercial purposes. VIZIO reserves the right to maintain your Personally Identifiable Information if VIZIO has suspended, limited, or terminated your access to the VIZIO web site or V.I.A. Services for violating any applicable Terms of Use or the VIZIO Internet Apps Software License Agreement.

Reviews.Title: Amazon instant video does not work on this TV - Package / description lies
Reviews.Author: Chad Rector "Chad"
Reviews.Content: I bought this specifically to watch Amazon instant videos. The official product description says it has an Amazon app, and there is a picture of the Amazon app on the top of the box. But when we set it up and selected the Amazon app it said that it was unavailable and they were working on it. I called Amazon tech support and they say oh yeah, despite what the official description says the Amazon app does not work on Vizeos. Amazon quickly agreed to a return and refund, which was nice but a better solution would have been for Amazon to fix the product description.Be sure to read other reviews and check the list of devices that work on Amazon instant video: http://www.amazon.com/gp/video/ontv/devices/ref=hp_3757_compatible

Reviews.Title: Update on initial review for Vizio LED TV
Reviews.Author: Donna C
Reviews.Content: I am updating my intial review below for my Vizio tv.  It seems I was not able to use the apps due to speed of internet connection.  I raised my speed and now the apps that I have tested do work with no problems.  Netflix and You Tube both loaded and ran with no issues.  The sound is good and it looks slim and sleek. I will be contacting my satellite provider to come out to check the cables and see if I can get a better picture since I do not have an HD receiver and programming.  However, since the local channels do air in HD, I should be able to have a better picture than I do. I'm sure when viewing DVD's on a blue ray player, the picture will be fantastic. I don't want to knock Vizio, as my daughter has had one for about 5 years now with no issues. I still think that Vizio offers a great product for the money.  I also must say that delivery was made sooner than I expected to receive it, so very happy with shipping/receiving experience as well. Amazon is a great place to shop!Initial Review - I just installed my new Vizio tv yesterday.  To my dismay, since I don't have an HD receiver, I will now have to obtain one, as the picture is not that great without it.  What really upsets me though, is the fact that the Apps do not work.  It recognized my wireless router, however, the Apps that I have tried are not working. Netflix takes a bit to load, then it takes a bit to be able to pick a movie.  When I tried playing a few movies, none of them would actually play.  It just kept buffering and then just froze.  Each time, I would get a message saying it appears that movie is not working correctly and I should try selecting another.  After three movies, I quit.  My tablet will play the movies, but not this Vizio.  If I can't get it to work, I will have no choice but to return it.  I was so happy to finally get my big screen smart tv..... but now, very, very, disappointed.

Reviews.Title: great picture, nagging problem- no solution from vizio
Reviews.Author: CHARLES H WALKER
Reviews.Content: purchased 1st tv and had the humming sound. after seeing the review which stated it appeared to be a back light problem i did my own experimenting and found it to be correct. called vizio, told them the problem and where it appeared to be coming from. their only suggestion was to reset the tv, which i did. the humming noise went away for about an hour and it came back. took the tv back to best buy, got it replaced with hope that humming noise would not be a problem with the replacement set. plugged it in and back came the humming noise, same area and seemed to be the backlight problem. took the tv back and purchased the new 39" panasonic tc-39as530u and it has been a gem.

Reviews.Title: dont buy
Reviews.Author: Peggy G.
Reviews.Content: I getting really mad I bought this tv and thought it was gonna be awesome I bought this and have only had it 2 months and now it just keep shutting off on its own im about to return it this is very messed up it was working great then out of themblue it just starts shutting off

Reviews.Title: OK Set, but not the best for the money
Reviews.Author: S. Speer
Reviews.Content: Received set quickly with Prime. First impression was that the set felt "flimsy". Picture was quite good when viewed straight on. Anything off center and the picture degraded quickly (common with LCD). Black level was lacking even with the local diming engaged. Ended up returning due to picture quality. No issues with the "Smart" features as other have had. Luckily I found one of the few remaining Panasonic Plasmas still in existence and couldn't be happier. Sure it has a mirror glass screen, but the blacks are incredible and the color is just, well, Plasma is just a superior technology (No matter what the manufacturers say!).

Reviews.Title: Not impressed
Reviews.Author: fthebaggers
Reviews.Content: Would give it a better rating if the apps actually worked properly. The amazon instant video doesn't function at all.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for what it is.
Reviews.Author: William Powers
Reviews.Content: I'm happy with the TV, however, I think applying the Smart TV label to these TVs is a bit unfair. I was looking for a smart tv, but I also wanted Bluetooth capability which I thought  was built into smart tvs. It isn't, it is built into another system apparently available on Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Internet capability terrible
Reviews.Author: Dennis D
Reviews.Content: This tv is good, but if you're looking for good and fast Netflix or Amazon instant video, forget it. The interface is slow and sluggish and you're better off with Chromecast. I bought this TV strictly for internet use, but ended up returning it because the internet performance was so poor. I had other TVs (chromecast) that worked great, but this TV had the message "Unable to connect to Netflix" and the connection to Amazon instant video kept disconnecting.Don't get this TV if you want good Netflix or Amazon instant video. It's terrible and slow.

Reviews.Title: No Amazon streaming
Reviews.Author: Hilary
Reviews.Content: Nice tv, but I really don't understand why the remote has an Amazon button even though it does not work.  Furthermore, there is an Amazon icon on the tv, but no dice.  Come on Amazon, all or nothing! Please make your product compatible with ALL devices including android phones!

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: SC
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying this is the first smart tv I have owned, and has been a big step up from my previous regular HDTV.Pros:Pretty good quality for the price.Image quality is great, plenty of preset (and customizable) profiles to choose from.Detects Films/movies so the image quality/refresh rate will adjust - Film doesn't look "fake," and you don't have to switch from 120hz to 60hz.Plenty of apps to choose from (though missing Skype, which I was hoping for. No big.)Sound isn't bad, I saw the reviews about the not-so-great sound/audio. It doesn't sound too bad.There's an EQ you can play with if you think the audio is too flat.RELATIVELY easy set up (see below...)Cons (mostly customer service, not product):TV has started to freeze sometimes (i.e. when changing between TV to App, or App to App) Only owned and functioning for about 3 weeks/1 month.. so I hope this will be extremely rare.No Skype.Packaging "layout" needs to be improved - The "neck" of the TV (piece that attaches screen to the base) was taped to the corner  of the box and not very visible. We thought the piece was missing, and almost threw it out. Which leads to...Unacceptable customer service (Vizio, not Amazon) -  we called about the missing piece, and were told it would be here in 8 business days.Firstly, ARE YOU KIDDING ME? If it was actually missing, that kind of turnaround is UNACCEPTABLE. I'm paying for prime, and the 2-day shipping. We want to watch our TV AS SOON AS IT ARRIVES.Secondly, this isn't a case of warranty parts. This is ORIGINAL PARTS, in ORIGINAL PACKAGING. You failed to include a vital  piece, you should overnight the cursed part to me. The shipping label should have been printing as I "yelled" at you over the phone.Thirdly, the piece took FOUR WEEKS to arrive. Bravo Vizio. You suck. I went on a 3-week business trip, and when I returned, the package still hadn't arrived.Luckily, I'm a great hoarder and I kept the box, so we found this piece later.

Reviews.Title: Terrible as second TV
Reviews.Author: Geoeve
Reviews.Content: To be fair, we're using this as our second tv - not plugged into the cable box via HDMI cord.That being said, just using the coax cable gives this tv a horrible picture!!!! This replaced a tv with the same set up - coax cable not plugged into box via HDMI, and same specs of 60 Hz- which had an infinitely better picture than this tv.This is called a "smart" tv because you can connect via your wifi to amazon, hulu, netflix, etc., but inputting the codes and passwords  is horrendously tedious given that you have to arrow over to the appropriate button and hit enter for every single character. A huge waste of my time. For all of that time and effort I can just go to my computer.This claims to be a 24" tv but that is not really accurate. The screen is 24" diagonally, but the picture does not expand to the length  of the screen (and, yes, we have tried changing the format from letterbox, etc.)This purchase was not worth the money, nor the effort I put into setting it up. I do not recommend buying this tv!

Reviews.Title: Broken
Reviews.Author: David James
Reviews.Content: I'm sure this TV is a good model if it arrives in one piece.  I bought it described as having "a few cosmetic blemishes, otherwise OK."  Not sure who dropped the ball here, either the company selling it didn't bother to check it when someone else returned it or it was damaged in shipping.  No way for me to know, but I suspect the former.  When I received it, there was no damage to the package, but the screen looked like a spider web and it was unusable.  I did get my money back and I learned a valuable lesson:  buy new, it's not worth the hassle to save a few bucks.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E-420
Reviews.Author: Suzanne Griffin
Reviews.Content: I just gave it that rating because my other Vizio is great.  The one you sent me is still in the box, as I will be moving on June 1, 2014.  I will write a new rating at that time, but I  am sure it will be just as great as the one I have.Thank you.Suzanne Griffin

Reviews.Title: Everything else in the house connects to my wi-fi without problems… except this TV
Reviews.Author: JanneyD "Janney"
Reviews.Content: I went through three levels of trouble shooting, then more trouble shooting with Comcast, which provides my wireless service.  The TV would connect to the wifi after a lot of trouble shooting, but would not get a strong enough signal to stream video.  Everything else in the house works fine, including a Roku stick which streams video when plugged into the TV.  Nonetheless the Vizio support states that either the TV is too far from the internet or the internet router needs to be replaced.  This does not make sense since the Roku stick, iPads, laptop, etc. all stream video just fine and Comcast says this particular model is finicky about the internet it accepts.  They offered to send a repair person out but at this point, my time is too valuable to deal with it and I would rather just buy a Roku stick for $49.  I would recommend that people skip paying extra for "smart" features on this television and just buy a Roku stick or something like it.

Reviews.Title: It alright
Reviews.Author: Shannon Bolden
Reviews.Content: Nice picture, app functions seem to work better if you are hard lined to the modem or wifi, which I feel defeats the purpose of it being wireless. Need keyboard remote for setup.

Reviews.Title: U get what U pay 4! EDIT!
Reviews.Author: jordan
Reviews.Content: There's a reason this 55" smart tv is under $700 and it simply doesn't compare to my LG 42" 60hz 1080 tv from 3 years ago.  I've searched all the forums for calibration settings and although the picture looks "good", it's not GREAT. I put both my 42" LG and this new Vizio side by side with identical HD/DVR cable boxes and I just can't sell myself on this Vizio. I'm going to keep searching the web for a fix since so many others seem to like it but I think I'll return this to Amazon and spend more $$$ for an LG or Samsung. If I keep the TV because it was cheap then I'll edit this review at a later date. Sorry kids I was really excited for the FED EX guy too and now I'm disappointed that I'll probably have to shell out a lot more $$$ for true quality and mind blowing effects. It's silly that a 4 year old LG beats this VIzio but its true. If this is your 1st HDTV, then you may not notice but if your're accustomed to real 1080p, then you'll be disappointed. EDIT!Well, my LG seemed to display 1080p just fine but I noticed this vizio was only in 480i. After some research, I had to change the setting on my cable box to display 1080p!!! Now that this vizio is running 1080, I think i may keep it. The picture is MUCH better since doing this last night but I'm still not "blown away". For under $700 I think it's worth it

Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: We love our new TV! It's awesome and for such a great price, it can not be beat! Kinda glad I busted our old one. lol

Reviews.Author: michael a brown
Reviews.Content: got this to replace my LG 37" that bored win wit end of last mouth the Hd is 10 times better then the LG  love fact i can link my t3i to it as will an my laptop will make it fun for playing battlefield 4 an hawks

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY!!!
Reviews.Author: DeCamp
Reviews.Content: I can only go as low as one star but I would go lower to half a star.My family has owned Vizio in the past and have had no problems until this one. I will get straight to the point, if you're going to buy a smart TV do not buy a Vizio!All the apps worked well.The picture was just okay even with vivid colors (which is the most clear one they had)The lighting kept fading in and outThe TV would update constantly causing freezesThe TV would randomly turn itself off even with the auto shut off turned off and the sleep timer turned off.The remote decided to not work at all even with fresh batteries.IT DOES NOT HAVE ANY OTHER BUTTONS ON THE TV ITSELF EXCEPT THE POWER BUTTON so once the TV would turn off, the volume reset itself to level 15. We purchased a universal remote to cover for the Vizio remote but with all the codes tried, the only things that would work was the info button, the volume, the input, and the power.In the end, it kept having trouble connecting from the internet even though it was fine when we first purchased it.We owned the TV for one month. Yes. ALL THIS HAPPENED IN LESS THAN 1 MONTH. DO NOT BUY! SAVE YOUR MONEY! SAVE YOUR TIME!

Reviews.Content: Warning.  The Amazon Prime video app foes not work for this TV yet.  Apparently Amazon does not consider this a priority.

Reviews.Title: Slightly Limited WiFi Security Capability
Reviews.Author: calintexas
Reviews.Content: I've only had the TV a few days. So far I'm really pleased with the picture and the way the TV generally works. I do have an issue with the WiFi setup. VIZIO customer service has just confirmed (what I found during initial set up) that the TV is limited to a 23 character WiFi security password, which, while likely adequate for most of us, is well below the 63 character limits of WPA/WPA2. I really want my Wifi network to be as secure as current standards allow.UPDATE: It's better than I thought. Within the manual Network setup screens is the ability to enter a 50 character WPA2 passphrase which while not the full 63 characters should be plenty secure. I learned this info from Bruce who answered my question about the passphrase character limits in the Customer Questions and Answers section; so, a big thank you to Bruce. Here is what Bruce had to say:"You will have to skip the steps in the automated setup. If you push the menu button on the remote, then select network in the menu, then select your network, then it will allow you to enter a password of whatever length you need. You will probably have to first agree to the terms of service before doing the first steps I spelled out."Now, as for VIZIO customer service: they answered my email in about 3 hours (incorrectly as it turns out). It's possible that I didn't ask the question precisely enough, and you could say that the answer was literally correct in that the passphrase is limited to 23 characters within the initial setup wizard. My experience shows the value yet again of the Customer Questions and Answers feature. Kudos to Amazon and the customers that share their experience for that.

Very frustrating. Completely false advertising.  I will be returning the TV.

Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv (costco, but same model) specifically because Amazon Prime is clearly shown on the box.Amazon Prime does NOT work with this series and hasn't for many months. Reviews.Author: Gerald P. Gutierrez
Reviews.Content: Maybe it is just bad luck- the tv was leaning noticeably forward on the stand it came with.  The directIons are quite straight forward but I disconnected the stand from the tv then connected it again.  Tv still was leaning still forward. Reviews.Title: OK but missing Name-brand options
Reviews.Author: Ty Spreadbury "Spreadfamily"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this product because Amazon indicated it was a great price with the best quality.  It is far from best quality in picture, connecting to internet, 100% dependency on remote control and especially very weak channel info.To be fair it is being compared to a 6 year old Samsung 52".  The Samsung always had an immediate good picture and when a black and white movie was on a simple picture display fixed the darkness.  The screen always had a real black background, the visio has absolutely no all-black background even though it says it does. We enjoy antennae TV and the Samsung shows what is, and will-be, playing on each station without clicking on the channel.  The Visio only shows what is currently playing on the channel being watched.  The Samsung has well hidden touch buttons that let you control the TV without the remote. The Visio cannot even be turned off without the remote (LOSE THE REMOTE AND YOU HAVE TO UNPLUG THE TV TO TURN IT OFF).  The Samsung will be playing a Blue Ray disc or other Connection and when your done you can simply click the channel up/down and it moves the connection to regular TV and the Visio needs to be guided through multiple steps to reconnect to the channels. The Samsung remote works pointing it anywhere in the direction of the TV even 20 feet away and the Visio remote only works pointing it at the lower left corner and you have to be close.  I have spent a lot of time (hours on and off during over 12 movie sessions) trying to get a decent picture but the contrast has never hit 'B' quality and the Samsung spoiled us with 'A+' quality.Now - Smart TV.  The bragging right was how wonderful it is to connect to the internet.  The Visio found the Wireless exactly like the few weak pages of instructions showed and it connected.  But NONE of the Internet apps can find an internet connection.  The error is there is no internet connection - yet - even the very very weak detailed manual that is built into the TV shows the Visio is indeed connected to the internet with great bandwidth.  There is no blockage on the router so the problem is 100% Visio. The troubleshooting section of the manual for the apps indicate to connect to the internet (no help).I have not called anyone because we have other access means to Smart apps that always worked wireless and no issues (on a Samsung Blue Ray).This is the 1st major disappointment with Amazon's reviews and we have shared our dislike with Visio to family and friends.  The dislike is how it is missing important options and a quality screen.

Reviews.Title: Worst. TV. Ever.
Reviews.Author: SJR
Reviews.Content: Although I'm frustrated and want to write an angry essay about this tv, I'll keep it concise for the sake of the reader1. WiFi connection capabilities is awful. I had a strong WiFi connection, but apparently the tv was "too far" from the router...aka downstairs. So if your tv is not within 30 feet or so of the router, then say bye-bye to any hope of watching Netflix or HuluPlus shows or being able use any of the "smart" features2. TV keeps turning off on its own3. Plastic-yAll in all, while having the same "smart" features as some of the more high profile brands (Samsung, Panasonic, etc), this tv lacks performance quality. If you're willing to sacrifice all that for the price, then go for it. I'm returning it and paying the couple extra hundred bucks for one that won't give me such a headache.

Reviews.Title: Unacceptable Customer Service
Reviews.Author: somdgirl
Reviews.Content: We rec'd this TV and the mounting screws for the base of the unit did not fit. We contacted Vizio cust. service. They told us to take the users manual to the hardware store and get the correct screws, which we did. The screws sent by Vizio were the correct screws according to the manual but the holes were improperly drilled. Vizio told us they would mail out replacement screws and noted they had this problem before. We told them the screws were fine but the holes were defective. They said they would send screws that fit. Then they told us we had to email them proof of purchase. We scanned the Amazon receipt and emailed. Now 10 days have gone by and still no screws have been sent to us. We called Vizio again and they said they could not read the email attachment we sent to show proof of purchase. They never bothered to call us or email us to let us know this. Then they told us they could not help us until we provided proof of purchase. The representative was rude, disrespectful and unwilling to help us solve this problem. This second rep refused to take any action and refused to transfer me to a supervisor unless I provided a serial number from the TV. She also kept repeating she needed to see the TV warranty. Although we tried numerous times to explain that this was a brand new TV not yet plugged in, she kept saying she had to verify it was under warranty. I was finally transferred to a supervisor only to be put on hold for 10 min.  I hung up. The rep called back and demanded to know why I hung up. I explained her support was rude and unacceptable and if this was the way Vizio treated their customers, I wanted no business with them. I told her I was calling Amazon to return the defective TV. She never apologized but then offered to send replacement screws without warranty verification and proof of purchase. I declined, stating I had no trust she would honor her offer and we knew the holes in the base were improperly drilled, not the wrong screws! I had no intention of attempting to resolve yet another issue w/this TV once I rec'd incorrect screws for a defectively drilled base. I called Amazon and reported the problem. Amazon was amazing, and sent a carrier within 3 days to pick up the TV as a defective return. Thank you Amazon for coming to our rescue!I hope our experience was isolated but felt the need to inform others of our deplorable experience.

Battery cover does not stay in place once the batteries are in. Buttons are small.2.) Apps are slow to load and not very responsive.3.) Reviews.Author: Crabby Techie "Dave"
Reviews.Content: I feel like this was false advertising. The TV prominently advertises Amazon Prime streaming, and has an Amazon-branded button on the remote, but all you will ever see is a message that the app is going to be updated to "bring you a better streaming experience." Indeed - any update would improve my streaming experience because right now it doesn't HAVE Amazon! It's impossible to find any information on when the app might actually work. Meantime, you're left with an M-Go app that doesn't work with devices on other content ecosystems. Save your money; just about any device can stream Netflix and I really wish I'd just bought a Roku to handle the streaming on a "dumb" TV instead.

Reviews.Title: just TERRIBLE
Reviews.Author: wasmannia
Reviews.Content: First of all, there should be an option to give an item zero stars because that's how bad this TV is.  The physical appearance is rather nice but when it's turned on, you soon realize the picture quality is just dismal.  I really wanted to like it but the image is grainy, motion blur is just so bad that any moving object blurs right out and the overall image quality is badly pixelated.  All in all, just awful!  Added to that is a hit-and-miss remote.  Some buttons are super sensitive so they double-enter when pressed and some buttons need to be pressed 2 or three times to get them to work.  The buttons are also way too small for comfort.  On the plus side, access to internet features such as Amazon Netflix etc work rather well.  It is possible I just got a dud, but will never buy another Vizio product as long as I live.  ZERO STARS!

Reviews.Title: Awful picture
Reviews.Author: Melina Gadless-sheedy "msheedy"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this television thinking it would be as good as my Sony. The picture is terrible and almost un-watchable. I called amazon and they sent a new one thinking it was a defective set. Not the case.  The televisin itself is the problem. I thought it was only during shows with a lot of movement like dancing......but even that shouldnt be the case.  The picture is blurry during any movement whether it is sports, dancing or the news.  I will never buy another one of these. I bought less expensive televisiions for my sons and the picture is perfect.  Never buy anything with a 30 day guarantee.  I am now stuck with a horrible $600 televison. Disgusting.

Reviews.Title: Manufacture flaws
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Long
Reviews.Content: This was billed as being a 1080p, but as the TV warmed up a small box that appeared at the top of the screen with the specs, showed it to be a 720p TV.We mounted this TV on the wall.  The bracket was attached to the wall and was installed perfectly level.  The TV was then fitted with the hangers that would hook onto the bracket.  The TV was not level.  Annoying!!  I knew the bracket was level because I took particular care to insure this.  Upon closer examination, I found that the four holes that the manufacturer provided to accept the hangers were not level.  I would have had to rehang the bracket out of level in order for the TV to hang level.  Not Good!  We then ordered a Samsung, which we should have done to begin with.

Reviews.Title: Amazon Instant Video is unavailable on this device.
Reviews.Author: Igor
Reviews.Content: Despite of dedicated Amazon Instant Video button on remote control,  the Amazon Instant Video is currently unavailable on this device. Amazon support team suggests to access video titles and access video library from computer or from another compatible instance Video device.Without Amazon Instance Video this model is good replacement for... well, photo frame.

You get an error stating that they are working on bringing a better app.  The plan was to use this in front of our treadmill as a prime only tv, we do not have cable or satellite.  Will reevaluate once the app comes out.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT purchase this TV if you expect the Smart TV to work with Comcast
Reviews.Author: PBChuck

The TV will connect to my WIFi and that's it.Let me first say that I'm a tech guy and have another TV that streams NetFlix, etc.VIZIO tech support was feeble, Comcast was actually very helpful but they stated there are a lot of issues with VIZIO products.Neither company can get it to access any of the smart tv apps.Stay away..

Reviews.Title: My TV  Rating
Reviews.Author: Theodore Gaines
Reviews.Content: I say this rating do to my facebook  page will not open for some apparent reason ,but other than that it 's great.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Experience!  Question retail packaging and hardware components
Reviews.Author: siebelnp
Reviews.Content: I would give this TV 0 stars if I could.  I went through 2 of these TVs.  The first would not power on.  So Amazon said they would send me another TV and told me they would make sure the next one was OK.  Next one came and huge spider crack on the front panel.  It seems either something malicious happened or there is not enough quality control with the product, I don't know how else to say it.  The product then went under review during this experience.  Went through the pleasure of packing, setting up, taking apart and then packing back up 2 inoperable TVs.  I gave this TV another chance and it was not a good surprise to have one with a giant gash on the front like someone through a baseball at it.  I don't know what happened with this model TV, but I am hearing the same reports on other web-sites.

Reviews.Title: Arrived damaged
Reviews.Author: WisconsinGal
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I read the other Vizio reviews that seemed to have quite a few "arrived damaged" -- more so than usual for an item, but I took a chance anyway.  Well I got burned, first time ever.  The TV looked fine until we plugged it in and saw that it had a crack below the surface of the screen, where apparently some fluid leaked out, creating a blob at the top of the screen, in the middle.  Then I went to Sam's Club and saw the same TV for the same price I paid on Amazon!  From now on this family is purchasing large items like this from a store--even if it costs more, it's not worth the hassle of packing everything up and shipping it back.

Reviews.Title: Poor Customer Support by Vizio
Reviews.Author: Marino
Reviews.Content: My experience with Vizio was terrible. I bought a Vizio Co-Star Video Stream in July 2013. Its Ethernet port never worked, but as it had a WIFI connection, I was able to use it until middle April 2014, when the WIFI connection also stopped working properly.I contacted Vizio Technical and Support area, but they did not provide proper support to address the issues and were not willing to replace the unit, even considering it was still under the 1-year purchase period. Vizio support was a nightmare for me, a waste of time and humor.I had so many issues with Vizio Technical and Customer Support channels. Their standard procedure is closing your request and ask you to contact another Vizio support channel, by e-mail, chat or phone. It seems Vizio objective is keeping you in an eternal looping, making you stressed and postponing a proper response/service.Considering my terrible experience with Vizio Customer and Technical Support, I will keep away from Vizio and its products.

Reviews.Title: No web browser and Amazon Prime does not work
Reviews.Author: Cambridge Amazon Reviewer
Reviews.Content: Bought this one today (not from Amazon) and thought I would share a few issues that are not immediately obvious. I am returning it tomorrow.1. The TV has a bunch of built-in apps, including Amazon Prime Movies. However, this feature does not work right now, I called Amazon and was told Vizio had not submitted their app updates for this type of TV. Called Vizio and got a relatively unfriendly rep who told me that this is an Amazon issue and has something to do with the FCC. She could not tell me if or when this will be resolved. Reviews.Title: Throwaway Product
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: Stay away from Vizio products! They are awful. I should have talked to my family friend who has been in the TV repair business for 30 years - vizios are crap. They are throwaway products. Literally, they cannot be repaired. Vizio does not manufacture replacement parts, so if a part dies, you will have two choices: 1) replace the part with a refurbished or "harvested" part or 2) buy a new TV. My Vizio's main board died after just four years. TV's should be lasting at least 7-10 years. Buyer beware!
